Job Description:
Regulatory Affairs Specialist (1 Year Contract/Up to $7000)

The Impact Youll Make in this Role
As a Regulatory Affairs Specialist, you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world. Primary Responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:

 Prepare Technical Documentation for Consumer Health products for use in Singapore and Malaysia
 Assure that all device listings, import licenses, and registrations for Consumer Health products are accurate and up to date
 Review product labeling and claims for compliance to applicable regulations
 Represent Regulatory Affairs on multidisciplinary project teams including New Product Introductions and Change Management Projects
 Provide local QMS, Distribution Quality assistance, audit support as required
 Communicate with regulatory authorities regarding regulatory affairs matters such as product registrations, changes in existing products and renewals.
 To handle, manage, communicate and follow up with stakeholders on and field safety notice action or related matters.
 Develop or maintain regulatory database and record as required.
 Participate and provide support within APAC Regulatory
 Ensure compliance with applicable regulatory requirements including those pertaining to product safety and post-market surveillance / vigilance
 Assist with other Asia related regulatory tasks as assigned

Your Skills and Expertise
To set you up for success in this role from day one, we require (at a minimum) the following qualifications:
1. Bachelor degree (completed and verified prior to start) from an accredited institution with relevant technical degree.
2. Minimum three (3) years of combined experience in quality assurance and regulatory compliance. High preference for experiences in consumer medical device product registrations.
3. Must be experienced in product registrations according to Singapore HSA regulations for medical devices. High preference for candidate to also have experience in product registrations according to Malaysias MDA regulations for medical devices.
4. Familiar with ISO13485 quality management systems and GDPMDS. High preference for candidate with experience in supporting quality audits.
5. Demonstrable effective cross-functional and intercultural working experiences in a global company.
6. Good English-speaking skillsets and proficient in Microsoft Office Tools.
7. Demonstrated ability to support technical efforts, with proven experience collaborating effectively with cross functional team members
8. Ability to multitask and prioritize personal workload to meet deadlines
9. Strong verbal and written communication skills with ability to provide diligent, concise and fact-based communication to Executive Management and cross functional peers
10. Strong attention to detail and good organizational skills.

Job Description:
Job Title: Pediatrician

Location: Singapore

GMP is partnering with a well known medical institution to identify Pediatrician Doctors for their operations in Singapore. You will provide compassionate and comprehensive medical care to pediatric patients from infancy through adolescence. You will collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of healthcare professionals to deliver high-quality healthcare services and promote the well-being of children and their families in our community.

Responsibilities:
Clinical Care:
Conduct pediatric assessments, physical examinations, and developmental screenings.
Diagnose and treat acute and chronic illnesses in pediatric patients.
Provide preventive care services, including immunizations, well-child visits, and health education.
Manage pediatric emergencies and coordinate referrals to specialists as needed.
Patient and Family Engagement:
Establish trusting relationships with pediatric patients and their families, demonstrating empathy, compassion, and cultural sensitivity.
Communicate effectively with patients and families, explaining diagnoses, treatment options, and medical recommendations in an understandable manner.
Address parental concerns, answer questions, and provide guidance on child development, nutrition, and behavior management.
Collaborative Practice:
Work collaboratively with nurses, nurse practitioners, physician assistants, and other healthcare professionals to provide coordinated care for pediatric patients.
Participate in multidisciplinary team meetings, case conferences, and quality improvement initiatives to optimize patient care outcomes.
Consult and collaborate with pediatric subspecialists and other medical specialists as needed for complex cases.
Qualifications:
Medical degree (MD or DO) from an accredited medical school.
Residency training in Pediatrics from an accredited residency program.
Board certification or eligibility in Pediatrics.
State medical license and DEA registration.
Strong clinical skills in pediatric assessment, diagnosis, and treatment.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Commitment to providing patient-centered care and promoting child health.
Ability to work collaboratively in a multidisciplinary team environment.
To find out more about this opportunity, please contact Steffan Lian at Steffan.Lian@gmprecruit.com

Job Description:
Interested applicants are invited to apply directly at the NUS Career Portal
Your application will be processed only if you apply via NUS Career Portal
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
The Alice Lee Centre for Nursing Studies (NUS Nursing), within the Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine at the National University of Singapore, is inviting applications for the positions of Assistant Professor (Tenurable Track) and Associate Professor (Tenure or Tenurable Track). NUS Nursing has a strong global reputation for its research and education, currently ranking among the top 20 institutions in the latest QS ranking by subject. We offer a comprehensive range of programs, including the undergraduate BSc (Nursing) programs, as well as postgraduate programs at the Master's and Doctorate levels.
Successful candidates will be appointed on a tenurable track Assistant Professor or tenure/ tenurable track Associate Professor position. As an academic staff member, you will have the chance to actively contribute to the dynamic academic community at NUS and play a pivotal role in shaping the future of nursing education and research.
Applicants should meet the following criteria:
Possess a PhD in Nursing or a related discipline (such as but not limited to Public Health, Psychology, Health Informatics) from a reputable university.
A track record of research and scholarly activities, including publications in reputable academic journals, is expected. Experience in securing external research grants or funding is beneficial (for Assistant Professor) / is required (for Associate Professor).
Demonstrate evidence of exceptional teaching and learning experience at a tertiary level, and the ability to contribute to team teaching in both undergraduate and graduate programs within NUS Nursing.
Exhibit knowledge and awareness of contemporary trends in teaching and learning, as well as evidence-based nursing practice and research.
Service to international research community such as editor or editorial board member would be advantageous.
Joining NUS Nursing provides an excellent opportunity to work with a renowned team of nursing educators, researchers, and practitioners. NUS Nursing is committed to fostering a supportive and inclusive environment, encouraging interdisciplinary collaborations, and promoting excellence in nursing education and research. We offers five research programmes that span a wide range of specialties and contribute to the advancement of healthcare:
Chronic Illness and Long-term Care
Education Innovation
Geriatric Care and Wellness
Patient Safety and Quality Care
Women and Children Health Care

Job Description:

As a discerning Masterplanner for environments that combines the Civic, Nature and Build Environments, this urban designing role requires your vision to shape and elevate high-caliber international urban design endeavors, ranging from vast city strategies to intimate district masterplans.

Job Description:
Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, theres no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And thats the kind of work we want to be part of.
Did you know that we are the 1st biologics contract manufacturer in Singapore? We offer you exposure to upcoming biotech and established pharmaceutical companies and to the manufacturing technology needed to produce mammalian treatments and cell therapies of tomorrow. Our global manufacturing network is recognized for its reliable, high-quality services, regulatory track record, global footprint, innovative technology platforms and extensive experience  we, in Singapore are proud to be part of this global network.
This is an exciting position who is responsible for QA oversight of Aseptic Processing Program, Environmental Monitoring and Microbial Control Policies for the Cell and Gene Therapy entity. Role will provide oversight and sterility assurance expertise to Operations to assure aseptic processing meets US and international aseptic processing requirements ( FDA Sterile Product Aseptic Processing Guidance and Eudralex, Annex 1, Sterile Medicinal Drug Products, ISO 13408 and 21CFR820).
The role will also provide strategic plan and expertise for the development and implementation of the Microbial Control Strategy. Develop, document and manage microbial control strategy for production processes from incoming raw materials through final product release.
Key responsibilities:
Provide support and expertise to ensure that Cell and Gene Therapy (CGT) and Media preparation operations and support functions for Cleanroom management, Materials Management, Aseptic practices, Environmental monitoring (EM). Sterilisation methods, and Aseptic process simulations (APS) to confidently deliver CT products to patients with the highest quality sterility assurance level.
Review policies and procedures and related completed media fill/APS documentation, Environmental Monitoring sample plans, cleanroom qualifications, environmental monitoring excursions, deviations and sterility failures.
Provide Sterility assurance expertise to support APS/EM deviations and investigations, CAPAs and Complaints related to aseptic processing.
Review of sterile filter validations, integrity testing and procedures.
Provide expert support and assessment to business partners including production, MSAT, Engineering, QC and QA assuring adequate facilities contamination prevention practices, monitoring tools are provided to production to guarantee the best EM indicator levels.
Involvement in global harmonization/ efficiency projects; begin to lead aspects of global projects within specific areas.
Represent site in global forums from sterility assurance perspective. Collaborate with stakeholders of different functions to lead/implement various global/site projects to support sterility assurance.
Support regulatory and client audits as Aseptic sterility assurance subject matter expert
Responsible for the generation of key performance indicators, GEMBA walks, regulatory compliance and efficiency targets.
Communicate quality operations and compliance perspective effectively to senior management.
Understand and articulate company business strategy. Maintains a broad view of the business recognizes changes and trends in the appropriate area in which the individual operates.
Key requirements:
Engineering/ Life Science Diploma/Degree or higher from recognized institution with significant years of QA or QC Sterile processing and Microbial experience in similar capacity.
GMP experience in the biologics industry is required.
Working knowledge of microbiological and sterility testing, media fills, environmental monitoring , clean room qualification and management, quality control endotoxin testing and microbiological control strategy required.
Experience with oversight of aseptic processing and the associated international aseptic processing regulations are required.
Experience in cell culture, cell or gene therapy experience is a plus.
Every day, Lonzas products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.
People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

Job Description:
Cleaning Operations Manager (Commercial and Environmental)

Job Summary:
The Operations Manager (Commercial and Environmental) is responsible for providing the overall direction of the organisation within the guidelines set up by the board of directors or a similar governing body. As a systems thinker, he or she will strategize and directs operational activities and translate organisational goals into achievable steps, anticipates and stays ahead of trends and takes advantage of opportunities. He or She will also mentor the management team as part of succession planning and represents the organisation in meetings with clients, investors and business partners.

He or She is expected to be at our project sites and build relationships with our clients and work closely with the Commercial and Environmental - Operations Executive as part of his role.

This requires him or her to be organised, strategic, adaptable, highly driven and capable of interacting with key stakeholders.

Job Responsibilities:
1. Lead teams
- Develop strategy plans to promote organisation core values
- Manage the professionalism of the staff
- Mentor and lead management staff
- Lead organisational succession planning, capability development and employee engagement

2. Drive business operations
- Drive the overall growth of business and operations
- Drive opportunities to improve market visibility and presence of the organisation
- Lead budget planning for the organisation
- Represent and promote the organisation
- Direct the development and review of operation policies and procedures

3. Manage client relationships
- Collaborate with clients to achieve business goals
- Direct the development and review of strategic plans to improve relationships with clients

4. Manage Incidents
- Oversee the conduct and review of contingency plans
- Endorse emergency and crisis management response plans, processes and procedures
- Provide direction on analysed trends of reported incidents

5. Manage cleaning services
- Coordinate with supervisor and client to ensure quality service delivery (compiling, analysing, development and review of operation plans to improve work procedures and quality service delivery)
- Ensure cleaning teams adhere to safety measures to during cleaning operation
- Assist in budget planning for cleaning operations
- Review daily cleaning job reports for submission to management
- Preparing periodic schedules and all other documentations and ensure all periodic schedules has been enforced and followed up accordingly.
- Covering of manpower if needed (requires you to do hands-on cleaning)
- Recruiting of manpower for projects
- Resolving all matters/ incidents on site

6. Manage inventory, equipment and maintenance schedule
- Stocktake and allocating of equipment and/or technologies and supplies to project sites
- Identify and recommend suitable equipment and/or technologies to improve cleaning operations
- Implement maintenance schedules for tools and equipment

7. Manage cleaning teams
- Facilitating in planning of work schedules, deployment of manpower, effective work processes and capability development of staff

8. Manage incidents
- Guide teams to respond to major incidents/emergencies and reporting it to the management

9. Any other tasks as assigned by the reporting officer.

Job Requirements:
- At least 7 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position.
- Preferably Managers specializing in Commercial and Environmental or Facilities Management

Job Description:
About The Role
We are looking for a passionate and experienced Regulatory Manager for our team in the APAC region. This role will focus on monitoring, overseeing and ensuring compliance of our Performance Chemicals product portfolio with existing and emerging chemical legislations as well as related application-specific regulations in countries across Asia Pacific. Efficient and effective coordination and communication of regulatory activities with global product stewardship & regulatory, regional regulatory experts and regional as well as global product management, including, e.g., early warning in case of regulatory threats and support in substance notification-related or other regulatory-driven topics, are of key importance for the role.
How You Will Do It
Monitor and stay up to date on the latest chemical legislations, regulatory requirements, guidelines and standards related to chemical compliance in Asia-Pacific via collaboration with country experts, the global regulatory network and by self-driven research.
Be the go-to person and coordinator for questions and processes related to relevant inventory-based as well as REACH-like regulations and Only Representative setups.
Develop and implement strategies to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, including the establishment of internal processes and procedures. Closely collaborate within the global regulatory team to align regional practices with global strategies and initiatives.
Conduct initial risk assessments to evaluate the impact of regulatory developments on the Performance Chemicals portfolio, facilitating further analyses by, e.g., product stewardship or product management.
Provide proactive guidance, support and training to internal stakeholders, including product stewardship & regulatory team members, product and business management as well as production and research on regulatory matters and requirements.
Liaise with regulatory authorities, industry associations, and external consultants to address regulatory issues and stay informed of any changes or updates.
Utilize regulatory data evaluation and maintenance tools, including SAP, to effectively manage and organize regulatory information.
What We Look For
Bachelors degree in chemistry, chemical engineering, environmental sciences, toxicology or related sciences
Minimum 5 years of proven experience in regulatory, product stewardship or related field within chemical or oil & lubricants industry.
Knowledge of chemical, product safety- and sustainability-related regulations/legislations in the Asia Pacific region
Strong analytical and research skills, with the ability to interpret and apply complex regulations and guidelines.
Detail-oriented, organized, and able to work collaboratively and independently in a fast-paced, global environment.
SAP knowledge as well as skills and openness towards digital solutions are an advantage.

Job Description:
Aspiring to practise both medical aesthetics and general practice? Consider joining Healthsprings where training will be provided.
Healthsprings is a medical clinic group established in 2000. It is helmed by a team of lady doctors. Our group include medical GP clinics, Aesthetic medical and laser clinics and medical spas.
We are looking for full time/part time doctors to join our team. We are located in Orchard, Bukit Panjang and Bidadari estate.
We are looking for doctors who are passionate in providing care to our patients in both the GP and Aesthetic Clinics. Training and supervision will be provided for those who are interested in performing aesthetic procedures in our clinics.
Job scope:
1) Provide consult and treatment of our patients in our GP clinics
2) Provide teleconsultation
3) Health screening
4) Provide Aesthetic services in our aesthetic clinics (training provided . Coc needed)
Job requirements:
1) Full registration with Singapore Medical Council
2) 3 to 5 years post graduation clinical experience in Singapore
3) Post graduate qualification will be an advantage eg GDFM or Mmed.
4) COC to perform aesthetic treatment (or applying for COC)
Benefits:
1) Competitive salary range from $12k to $18k depending on experience, qualifications and number of working hours. Performance bonus and commission pay for treatment done.
2) Work life balance with Flexible work hours arrangement
3) Family oriented company with perks including use of company cars
Job Types: Full-time, Part Time
Part-time hours: 20 - 42 per week
Salary: $12,000.00 - $18,000.00 per month
Supplemental pay types:
1) Commission pay
2) Performance bonus
skills: ['Aesthetics', 'Hospitals', 'Clinical Research', 'Public Health', 'Treatment', 'Healthcare', 'Medicine', 'Telehealth', 'Disease Management', 'Screening', 'Able To Work Independently']

Job Description:
The Regional Commercial Manager, RCM is primarily responsible for strategizing, planning and executing for business growth. The job holder leads and manages the Regional Sales and Marketing Team to develop new customer segments, create demands, identify opportunities, source for leads, engage the prospects, follow through and secure the deals to meet/exceed the sales targets, as well as to engage, train, service and support the customers and users on an on-going basis.

The RCM also works closely with the Managing Director to drive and foster a culture of accountability, performance, excellence, innovation and continuous improvement.


RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Strategic Development and Sales Management
Drive the pursuit of the companys mission, vision and core values to foster a committed, competent and growth-oriented workforce.
Strategise and plan for business growth to achieve the overall financial performance targets and sales targets for various products of Singapore.
Lead and drive the formulation and execution of sales plans and activities
Drive a culture of accountability, performance and excellence and by setting out well-defined job roles, clear performance goals and relevant measurement metrics as well as providing due recognition for the sales and business development team.
Drive a culture of effective cost management and resource optimisation.
Lead change management in an integrated manner, lead transformation projects and deal with issues to improve organisational agility and performance.
Foster strategic business partner relationships to further the Groups business objectives
2. Branding, Marketing and Products Development
Oversee the organising of marketing and promotion events and activities, education and collaboration with Key Opinion Leaders and suppliers.
Formulate demand creation strategies and new product service offerings, sharpen sales channel utilisation and lead new business initiatives to improve revenue streams and meet market demands
Continually engage customers and users to understand their evolving needs and introduce new products and solutions to meet their needs.
Lead the scanning and assessment of industry developments, competition landscape customers evolving needs, government initiatives and regulatory changes to identify and seek business opportunities.
Conceptualise and decide on branding matters, marketing positioning and communications, as well as review and approve marketing materials/collaterals
Support and facilitate the country directors and business unit managers to formulate and execute sales plans and activities
Continually review the portfolio of solutions and products and decide on initiatives to boost sales, maintain profitability or enhance customer stickiness
Identify, source and introduce new solutions and products that are of interest and value to customers.
Lead the launch plans, training & competency assessment to support the roll out of new products
3. Process Efficiency and Adoption of Technology
Provide oversight and direct the improvement of business processes and work procedures to raise productivity and efficiency
Direct and oversee implementation of customer relationships management and process improvement projects, jointly with the local Offices
Critically oversee cost management ensuring that resources are optimally utilised, wastages are minimised, and inventory is moving and at optimal level.
Drive the identification and implementation of new technologies to enhance business

REQUIREMENTS
Degree in Business Management or Healthcare related discipline
Minimum 10 years of relevant working experience in commercial role with at least 3 years in a senior manager role
Familiarity with the medical device or Homecare industry
Leadership and managerial skills and experience
If you are keen to develop a career and make a mark in the medical sector within a dynamic and fast-scaling organization, and also to make a difference in the medical industry, we invite you to apply online with a comprehensive resume.

We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted

Job Description:
Chugai Pharmabody Research Pte. Ltd. (CPR) was established in Singapore as a wholly-owned subsidiary of Chugai Pharmaceutical Co., Ltd (Chugai), a member of Roche group, in January 2012 and started operations on July 2, 2012. Located at Biopolis in Singapore, it aims to generate new antibody drugs based on Chugais proprietary antibody engineering technologies, such as recycling antibody, sweeping antibody, bispecific antibody, various Fc engineered antibodies, and other new antibody engineering technologies that are under development.

Senior Research Support Officer in Research Support Unit

Facility Management:
Establish short term (1  3 years) and long term (5 years and above) facility management plan to be in line with companys business continuity plan.
Establish the facility monitoring system in cooperation with external vendors.
Conduct facility management, such as repair works and maintenance works, in cooperation with external vendors.
Arrange the relocation of lab and equipment in line with research activities.
Schedules and oversees the use of space, resources, and lab/equipment in line with research activities.
Requirements:
General degree with minimum 8 years of facility management experience in the life science industry.
Business proficiency in Japanese Language is a must to liaise with Japanese speaking colleagues and clients.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Applications such as Word, Powerpoint, Excel, Outlook, Forms etc.
Interested applicants are invited to apply with their detailed resume, qualifications, availability, current and expected salary.
For more information regarding our Company, you may refer to our website at:

http://chugai-pharmabody.com/

Job Title: Senior  Speech & Language Therapist  Chaoyang School
Job Description:
Job Purpose:
You shall be responsible for the speech language programme for students &/or trainees with oral communication challenges including evaluation of all students &/or trainees with suspected or identified communication disorders and the development, management and coordination of a speech and language programme, including difficulty in swallowing.

Key Responsibilities:

Consultation
Provide professional inputs to support understanding of clients speech, language and communication difficulties to teachers, parents/caregivers, professional staff, administrators and the public.
Participate in collaborative problem-solving to assist teachers, parents / caregivers, professional staff and administrators with practical ideas and recommendations in the setting of goals, selection and design of intervention programs, etc.
Assessment
Provide screening, identification, assessment, diagnosis, treatment and follow-up services for students/trainees with speech and language disorders.
Measure outcomes of treatment and conduct continuous evaluation
Identify effective practices and programs to improve and enhance quality of
services.
Able to apply formal and informal modes of assessment.
Maintain efficient client records and documentation. i.e. Assessment reports filing in students confidential file.
Treatment Strategies
Implement intervention program based on assessment, interpretation and planning.
Discharge Planning
The Speech and Language Therapists should write a discharge based on the following:
Documented evidence showing that the student has achieved all the objectives or the students can no longer benefit from the therapy.
The student to be discharge from therapy services if he/she leaves the school.
Recommend other services, if applicable to the student and other family members.
Refer and write a discharge summary, if necessary, when the student is going to another service or an APSN School.
Training and Support
Train and support teachers, caregivers and other communication partners of individuals with speech, language, communication difficulties.
Mentor and supervise of support personnel.
Job Requirements:
Recognized degree in Speech Pathology from accredited college/ university
Good team player with strong communication and interpersonal skills
Relevant work experience ranging from children to young adults with intellectual disability would be an advantage
Ability to work with independently and with minimum supervision
Valid practising certificate with Allied Health Professional Council (AHPC)
Entry level candidates who recently completed the studies in Speech Pathology are welcome to apply. We will provide AHPC supervision requirements and support.

Job Description:
Job Purpose:

You shall be working closely with various stakeholders to provide assessment, intervention, consultation and training services to address clients learning/emotional/behavioural needs and difficulties.

Key Responsibilities:
Assist and assess clients behaviour and needs via observation, interviews and informal tests.
Assist, administer and monitor appropriate treatment strategies and therapy modalities, with support from Psychologist or Senior Psychologist.
Assist, plan and deliver individual or group interventions in collaboration with Psychologist or Senior Psychologist.
Work with other allied health professionals and direct service staff to provide multi-disciplinary support to the clients so as to maximize their capabilities.
Work with direct service staff (teachers), caregivers and families to implement intervention strategies and programmes, and to provide consultations to them, as necessary.
Maintain updated client records of interventions and reports.
Assist and conduct relevant discipline-related training to direct care staff, care givers and families, and volunteers.
Participate and contribute in APSN-CYS initiated special projects such as public education, conferences, applied research, deputyship applications, etc.
On-site structured job training will be provided by Psychologist or Senior Psychologist
Job Requirements:

Technical Competencies/ Preferred achievements / characteristics:
Strong academic background and Degree in Psychology from a recognised University in Singapore
Has strong inclination to pursue master programme in applied psychology in near future
Fresh graduates are welcome to apply.
Core Competencies:
Good communication, team work, and interpersonal skills.
Passionate for working with persons with intellectual and developmental disabilities ( Pediatric population)

Job Description:
We are looking for a passionate and dedicated Physiotherapy Lecturer to join our team at HMI Institute of Health Sciences Pte Ltd. This role is integral in shaping the future of healthcare professionals by providing high-quality training and mentorship to our students. As a Physiotherapy Lecturer, you will be responsible for planning, delivering, and assessing engaging training programs that meet HMI Institute's standards and align with industry requirements. If you are driven to inspire and empower the next generation of healthcare practitioners, we encourage you to apply.

RESPONSIBILITIES
The Physiotherapy Lecturer is responsible for planning, delivering, assessing, and continuously improving training programs to ensure students meet the required competency standards. This role ensures training remains relevant, up-to-date, and compliant with HMI Institute and external accreditation standards.

MAIN DUTIES
 To carry out the duties of a lecturer, counselor and mentor to students assigned to you in your course of duties.
 To implement and assess various assessment methods to evaluate student competencies, ensuring alignment with learning outcomes and professional standards.
 To manage, coordinate and supervise course instructions and assessments effectively, without compromising training standards and quality

SECONDARY DUTIES
 Design, develop, and enhance curriculum materials, including lesson plans, assessments, and practical training components, to meet industry standards and regulatory requirements.
 Assist in the design and launch of new courses and programs to address emerging needs in physiotherapy and healthcare.
 Regularly review and update existing course content to reflect advancements in physiotherapy practices and align with current healthcare industry needs.
 Participate in curriculum review meetings to ensure continuous improvement in course quality, relevance, and instructional methodologies.
 Undertake related tasks and projects as assigned by the organization to support the broader mission and objectives of HMI Institute.

Requirements

Qualifications
 At least a bachelor degree in physiotherapy from a recognized university;
 Obtained Advanced Certificate in Learning and Performance (ACLP) or Advanced Certificate in Training and Assessment (ACTA).
 Currently registered as a physiotherapist in Singapore

Skills/Knowledge
 Strong knowledge of physiotherapy principles, techniques, and practices;
 Excellent communication and presentation skills;
 Enthusiasm for teaching and mentoring future healthcare professionals;
 Proficient in relevant software and educational tool;
 Commitment to maintaining a positive and inclusive learning environment.

Working Experiences
 At least 5 years of experience in physiotherapy role;
 At least 2 years of experience as a therapy educator would be advantageous.

Personalities
 Clear, approachable communication style that fosters open dialogue and an engaging learning environment.
 Ability to pay close attention to details in curriculum development, assessments, and student evaluations to maintain high training standards.
 Willingness to work with a team of educators and staff, contributing to a positive and collaborative work environment.
 Openness to ongoing professional development and staying updated on current physiotherapy practices and teaching methodologies.
 Comfortable adapting to evolving educational needs and changes in the healthcare industry.
 Ability to connect with students, understand their challenges, and provide support with patience and understanding.

Job Description:
Assist to coordinate and control environmental trainings, record-keeping, inspection, audits, etc. applies to company operations.
In addition, assist the Environmental Manager with internal or external environmental audits of all annexes;
Assist with environmental impact and assessments, environmental protection plans and waste management plans;
Assist with environmental training in disciplines ranging from solid and hazardous waste management, general environmental awareness and installation subject-matter;
to advise on and develop the management of solid and hazardous waste streams;
to be part of a creative team tasked with developing innovative economic and eco-friendly working practices.
To act on behalf of Environmental Manager during his absence, and to coordinate and control monthly Environmental deliverables with resect to the A-1800000 contract.

Basic Job Qualifications:
1. Proficient in English language. Both written and spoken.
2. Computer literate, including word processing, spreadsheets, power-point, graphic/chart and database management.
3. Environmentally motivated, and with a strong desire to make a difference.
4. Committed to Continuous Professional Development and take every opportunity for further training.
5. Take personal initiative, be self-motivated, and have the ability to follow specific directions.
6. Possess current valid Drivers License
7. Forklift license is added advantage.

Position Specifications: Special Certifications or Training
1. Training or experience in the management of environmental compliance, solid waste, pest control, and hazardous waste is preferable.
2. Successful completion of initial and annual refresher training in accordance with Hazardous waste training requirements.

Education:
1. A minimum of Diploma school education, or a Degree or any professional certificate related to Environmental-related discipline, or equivalent work experience may be substituted.

Experience
1. Minimum of three (2) years experience in Environmental-oriented job.

Job Description:
Job Description  Senior Regulatory Affairs Executive
Drafting, compiling and maintaining of technical documents to ensure compliance to the applicable domestic and international regulations and standards , specifically EU MDR 2017/745
Prepare and submit regulatory technical documentations to regulatory authorities for new registrations, renewal and change notification (eg US FDA, SG HSA, AUS TGA etc)
Ensure compliance with applicable regulatory requirements and standards for medical device.
Work closely with internal team for documentation and information gathering.
Liase with various regulatory authorities and authorised representatives on requirements needed to facilitate product approval and address any deficiencies and queries.
Support in adverse event reporting, report adverse event regulatory authorities in relevant countries within the stipulated timeline, when required.
Participate in internal / external audits as part of the audit team (including supplier audit)
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of regulatory requirements and changes
Ensure post-market surveillance obligations are complied with regulations
Any other ad-hoc assigned

Qualification Requirement
Bachelors degree in biological science, biological engineering, pharmacy or related field;
4-5 years of experience in medical device regulatory affairs with experience in FDA 510(k) or CE marking
Familiar with relevant regulatory guidelines and standards such as ISO 13485, EU MDR 2017/745
Strong attention to detail and organization skills;
Ability to work independently and as part of a team;
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills;
Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Job Description:
Ready to power a greener future? Apply today to be at the forefront of renewable energy growth!

Join our established client as a lead global renewable energy sector to be the key player in shaping a sustainable future.

As a Global Business Development Manager, you will expand regional market presence, foster strategic partnerships, and drive projects in sustainable energy. This dynamic role focuses on market expansion, land acquisitions, and project execution while collaborating with international government authorities.

Work Location: Singapore (International Travel Required)
An opportunity to work globally, collaborate with diverse teams, and play a pivotal role in sustainable energy innovation
ONLY Singaporean can be considered due to project requirements

Business Development / Market Expansion: Identify and analyze new land opportunities (globally) for sustainable energy, forge strong partnerships, and create strategies for market entry
Partnerships & Negotiations: Build relationships with global stakeholders and secure project permits and documentation.
Project Management: Oversee projects from feasibility studies to final execution, ensuring regulatory compliance and timely delivery.
Leadership & Collaboration: Lead cross-functional teams to drive innovation and success


Ideal Candidate Profile:
Bachelor's in Engineering Management or related field
More than 5 years in renewable energy business development and project management in a global business setting
Proven track record in managing high-impact, large-scale projects with international reach
Strong understanding of the global renewable energy landscape, including familiarity in regulatory environments, technological advancements, andrenewable energy and environmental conservation industry trends
Proven leadership, negotiation, and cross-functional team management skills
Exceptional negotiation and communication skills
Frequent international travel is required for land evaluations and/or meetings with government authorities

Job Description:
Job Title: Hospital Food Service Assistant
Job Description: We are seeking a dedicated and compassionate Hospital Food Service Assistant to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for assisting patients with their meal orders, ensuring dietary needs are met, and managing multiple orders efficiently within the ward.
Key Responsibilities:
Assist patients in selecting their meals, taking into account dietary restrictions and preferences.
Accurately record and relay meal orders to the kitchen staff.
Deliver meals to patients in a timely and courteous manner.
Manage multiple meal orders simultaneously, ensuring accuracy and efficiency.
Communicate effectively with patients, nursing staff, and kitchen personnel.
Maintain a clean and organized work environment.
Address any patient concerns or special requests regarding their meals.
Ensure compliance with hospital food safety and hygiene standards.
Requirements:
High school diploma or equivalent.
Previous experience in food service or healthcare settings is preferred.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to manage multiple tasks and work in a fast-paced environment.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
Compassionate and patient-focused attitude.
Ability to work flexible hours, including weekends and holidays.
Basic knowledge of dietary restrictions and nutrition is a plus.
Benefits:
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities for professional development and growth.
Supportive and collaborative work environment.
To find out more about this opportunity, please contact Steffan Lian at Steffan.Lian@gmprecruit.com

Job Description:
Job Description

The Staff Nurse is responsible for facilitating change and improving lives for individuals, families, community facing transitional challenges through the provision of direct services. He / She will act professionally at all times and be accountable to the client and the organization to ensure that intervention plans are developed and implemented according to professional judgment and knowledge.

Job Responsibilities

- Render care to clients in accordance with the Singapore Nursing Board (SNB) Code for Nurses and Midwives
- Provide overall in-charge for Home Care Services (HCS), such as but not limited to
o Environmental and biopsychosocial assessments
o Collaboration with family members to determine suitability for HCS
o Provision of clinical services to support clients needs and department operation.
- Perform clinical skills such as medication assistance, tube feeding, stoma care, and catheter management
- Develop individualised care plan base on clients needs with person-centred approach
- Oversee clients medical / nursing needs and ensure service delivery according to service contract and maintains documentation accordingly
- Collaborate and co-operate with internal and external care team members for co-managed cases
- Conduct education and training sessions for caregivers and / or clients to promote person-centred care needs
- Conduct in-service training sessions to guide and support staff and volunteers
- Develop and review workflows or Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) to aid operation needs
- Recommend new strategies for service development and quality improvement / excellence to supervisor and / or manager
- Be a good team player, building positive influence to team and motivated to learn and grow towards self-excellence
- Perform any other duties as directed by supervisor and / or the management

Qualifications
- Diploma/Bachelor Degree in Nursing

Other Information

Relevant Experience
- At least 2 years of relevant experience.
Experience with community nursing is preferred

Competencies
- People-oriented and good interpersonal skills
- Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
- Attention to details
- Good verbal and written communication skills
- Committed and can-do attitude
- Team Player

Job Description:
Core Duties:
 Engage in computer-based tasks for registeration, inpatient and outpatient services and provide assistance as needed.
 Receive and prepare patients for their radiographic procedures, ensuring their comfort and well-being in waiting areas.
 Prepare imaging/procedure rooms, maintaining cleanliness and tidiness in waiting areas and changing rooms.
 Assist Radiographers during procedures, including chaperoning and transferring patients as required.
 Assist patients in selecting appropriate hospital gowns for different procedures before radiographic procedures.
 Clean X-ray accessories, imaging plates, and replenish departmental stocks and supplies.
 Maintain the overall cleanliness of the department to uphold hygiene standards.

Job Description:
Following a year of success, an Asian Pharma company is looking to start their second phase of growth after entering Singapore just last year. They are currently looking for a BD Manager to help continue their growth across SEA.

As the BD Manager you will be looking to develop a network of partners across SEA to drive the sales of the companys products, the who, how and where will be up to you. They have a large product portfolio of products that they want to bring to SEA.

There will also be the opportunity to look at doing deals that will bring new products into the company via licensing or acquisition.

The BD Manager will be responsible for:
Lead or support the introduction of Singaporean products/technologies into China and oversee export initiatives to Southeast Asia, including supplier and customer management, project registration, and contract handling.
Conduct initial screening, negotiations, and tracking of investment projects in Singapore and Southeast Asia.
Maintain relationships with local government in Southeast Asia and handle additional business development activities as required.
The BD Manager will be / have:
BD experience in pharma industry

Degree qualified

Job Description:
We are currently looking for an R&D Team Lead for a global ingredients business for the Biopharma industry. This will involve you taking over and growing an already existing team here in Singapore whilst also being part of a wider global R&D organization. This role combines a mix of the autonomy you would expect at a smaller company but with the financial muscle of a large business.

This role is slightly different from a standard R&D Team Lead role however as you will work not only on internal product development projects but will also be supporting customers in the development of their projects too.

The R&D Team Lead will be responsible for:
Oversee project management, resource allocation, mentorship, and safety compliance to support the cell culture teams growth and productivity.
Drive R&D strategy, coordinate innovation projects, and work cross-functionally to align with business objectives and launch new products.
Engage with customers, senior management, and global teams, providing scientific insights and supporting marketing efforts through publications and application data.
The R&D Team Lead will be / have:
Proficient in mammalian cell culture, especially CHO cell culture for therapeutic protein production, with strong analytical skills.
Proven experience in leading multidisciplinary teams, mentoring, and managing projects to meet business objectives.
Degree qualified: PhD or Masters in Biotechnology, Pharmaceutical Engineering, Biology or related Life Science fields preferred.
Excellent communication, presentation, and decision-making abilities, with experience prioritizing multiple tasks in a lab environment.

Job Title: Assistant Director Informatics  Eastern General Hospital Planning Office
Job Description:
The upcoming Eastern General Hospital (EGH) aims to provide excellent healthcare and promote healing centred around each person. When operational, EGH will provide a comprehensive range of inpatient and outpatient clinical specialties and healthcare services, covering emergency, acute and secondary care. EGHs vision is to be a hospital for the community and a great workplace for staff. It seeks to do so by harnessing innovative technologies in patient care, journeying closely with patients and the community to lead healthier and more fulfilling lives, and being an employer of choice that empowers staff in their careers.
In this role, you will plan intelligent / autonomous systems to support the clinical and operational needs of EGH, aiming to achieve the mission and vision of the new institution in transforming healthcare service delivery. Your responsibilities will include overseeing the smooth operations of the Healthcare Living Lab (HLL) with the Development Secretariat, which is set up to conduct integration testing and trial new technologies. You will engage multi-disciplinary teams to ensure the successful and smooth implementation of these new technologies at EGH. Additionally, you will undertake and lead a team in research and development for the operation of intelligent systems for healthcare.
Job requirements
Bachelors degree in Electrical / Mechanical / Computing Engineering
At least 12 years of relevant experience with exposure at management level, and at least 5 years in software programming/ engineering/integration work
Team player with excellent planning, analytical and communication skills
Possess critical thinking skills and willingness to think outside the box
Able to engage various stakeholders in a fluid environment and a growing organisation
Ability to work under pressure and adapt to challenging conditions
Good knowledge of both front-end and back-end designs of products/-systems
Familiarity with quick prototyping tools e.g. Unity, Wire framing, Solidworks
Familiarity with management of engineering collaboration platforms e.g SLACK/GitHub
Knowledge in areas such as
Robotic Platforms
Familiarity with software development on/with robotic platforms, SLAM, or related fields.
Experience in the following is preferred:
Robot Operating System(ROS), Gazebo, Unity, Linux, OpenCV
Robotics perception, LIDAR, object tracking, motion planning, machine learning, sensor fusion and system engineerin
Embedded and real-time systems
Algorithm development in C/C++, Python. Unix shell scripting

Job Description:
Note: This role will require travel to China and Vietnam for approximately 10 months per year. Proficiency in Mandarin is essential for effective communication with Chinese-speaking clients and stakeholders.

Job Overview:
The ESG Manager will lead the companys sustainability initiatives, driving the integration of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) strategies within the consumer electronics manufacturing industry. This role will be responsible for ensuring compliance with sustainability standards, enhancing long-term value, and promoting responsible corporate practices. The ESG Manager will collaborate with both internal and external stakeholders to advance sustainability goals, uphold corporate governance, and ensure transparency in ESG reporting.
Key Responsibilities:
Environmental Responsibility (Sustainability Focus):
Sustainability Strategy Development: Assess the companys environmental footprint, focusing on areas such as resource consumption, waste management, energy efficiency, and carbon emissions. Develop and implement sustainable practices aimed at minimizing the companys environmental impact.
Regulatory Compliance: Ensure compliance with local and international environmental regulations. Oversee environmental audits and prepare reports for compliance purposes.
Sustainable Projects Leadership: Spearhead projects that drive the transition to green energy, carbon reduction, and circular economy practices, fostering sustainability throughout the product lifecycle and business operations.
Social Responsibility:
Employee Wellbeing: Champion the development and implementation of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) policies to create a safe, inclusive, and supportive workplace.
Community Engagement: Lead community outreach efforts and corporate social responsibility (CSR) initiatives to positively impact local communities through volunteering, philanthropic efforts, and social investments.
Supply Chain Accountability: Monitor and enforce social responsibility practices within the supply chain, ensuring suppliers meet labor standards, health and safety regulations, and other social criteria.
Corporate Governance:
Governance and Ethical Standards: Ensure all corporate governance practices align with legal, ethical, and best practice standards. Advocate for strong governance frameworks that promote accountability and transparency.
Risk Management: Identify and assess ESG-related risks, implementing effective mitigation strategies to protect the companys reputation and financial health.
ESG Reporting: Prepare comprehensive ESG reports and communicate key sustainability metrics to internal stakeholders, investors, and regulatory bodies, ensuring transparency and accountability in performance.
Additional Responsibilities:
Collaboration and Stakeholder Engagement: Foster partnerships with government agencies, NGOs, investors, and other stakeholders to support and enhance ESG efforts.
ESG Ratings and Performance: Monitor and enhance the companys ESG ratings across various platforms, positioning the company as a sustainable investment choice for socially responsible investors.
Market Trends and Policy Monitoring: Keep abreast of global ESG trends and regulatory changes, adjusting corporate strategies as necessary to ensure ongoing compliance and leadership in the field.
Requirements:
Bachelors degree or higher in Environmental Science, Sustainability Studies, Business Administration (with a sustainability focus), Public Policy, or a related field.
At least 10 years of professional experience, with a minimum of 5 years in ESG management, particularly within the consumer electronics manufacturing industry, and a deep understanding of ESG frameworks and standards.
Proven expertise in corporate governance and social responsibility initiatives.
Strong communication, coordination, and collaboration skills, with the ability to influence and engage stakeholders at all levels.
Previous experience in project or corporate management is highly desirable.
Willingness to travel frequently and work abroad in China and Vietnam for up to 10 months per year, including annual round-trip tickets to Singapore and separate living accommodations.

Job Description:
Location: Singapore & Malaysia
Industry: Healthcare, Wellness, and Stem Cell Therapy

Role Summary:
We are seeking a dynamic and results-driven General Manager to lead and oversee our operations in Singapore and Malaysia. This role will focus on our healthcare and wellness business, specifically in the field of stem cell therapy. The ideal candidate will have experience in a public company environment and the ability to contribute to fundraising efforts. You will be responsible for managing profit & loss, cash flow, and the overall performance of the company.

Key Responsibilities:
 Operational Leadership: Lead the day-to-day operations across both Singapore and Malaysia, ensuring smooth execution of business strategies and meeting organizational objectives.
 Financial Oversight: Manage P&L, cash flow, and budgeting, ensuring financial health and profitability. Monitor key financial metrics and provide strategic recommendations to improve performance.
 Business Development: Drive growth through strategic partnerships, identifying new opportunities for business expansion. Collaborate with the leadership team to develop and implement new business models and initiatives.
 Fundraising & Investor Relations: Support fundraising activities, including liaising with investors, potential partners, and stakeholders. Contribute to investor communications and financial reporting.
 Compliance & Governance: Ensure operations are compliant with all legal and regulatory requirements in both Singapore and Malaysia. Maintain strong relationships with relevant authorities and stakeholders.
 Team Leadership: Lead, mentor, and motivate a cross-functional team, fostering a culture of excellence and accountability. Provide guidance to senior managers and department heads.
 Market Strategy: Monitor industry trends and competitor activity, providing insights and strategic direction to stay ahead in the healthcare and wellness market.
 Customer Experience: Ensure a high level of customer satisfaction by maintaining quality standards and improving operational efficiencies in service delivery.

Requirements:
 Experience: Proven experience (5+ years) in healthcare, wellness, or related industries, with a strong focus on operations management. Experience in a public company setting is a plus.
 Leadership Skills: Strong leadership abilities with a proven track record of successfully managing teams and driving organizational change.
 Strategic Thinking: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to think strategically and execute tactically.
 Fundraising & Business Development: Experience in fundraising or investor relations is highly desirable. A strong network in the healthcare, wellness, or stem cell therapy industry is an advantage.
 Financial Acumen: Solid understanding of financial management, P&L responsibility, budgeting, and cash flow management.
 Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to communicate effectively with both internal teams and external stakeholders.
 Hands-on & Results-Driven: Proactive, hands-on, and results-oriented approach to driving business success.
 Educational Qualification: A degree in Business Administration, Healthcare Management, or a related field is preferred.

Job Title: Deputy Director  Assistant Director Community Health
Job Description:
Overview:
Our Healthcare client is seeking a dynamic and visionary Deputy Director/Assistant Director to spearhead our community health initiatives. This role offers an exciting opportunity to lead the development and execution of strategies that promote health and wellness across diverse communities.

Key Responsibilities:
Innovative Strategy Development: Craft and implement cutting-edge strategies and frameworks for community health programs that drive real, measurable outcomes.
Empowerment & Engagement: Design and roll out plans that empower communities to take proactive control of their health. Cultivate a vibrant culture focused on preventive care and healthy living.
Strategic Partnerships: Forge and nurture strategic partnerships with grassroots organisations, social service agencies, and healthcare providers to enhance integrated care and improve overall population health.
Leadership Excellence: Inspire and guide a talented team, ensuring they have the resources and support needed to thrive. Promote a collaborative and high-performance work environment.
Impactful Initiatives: Develop and oversee initiatives that make a tangible difference in community health and integrated care, leveraging your expertise to drive success.
What Were Looking For:
Bachelors Degree in healthcare or business-related fields.
A minimum of 10 years of relevant experience in healthcare, strategic planning, and partnership development, with at least 5 years in a leadership capacity.
Proven strategic thinker with a track record of successful planning and execution.
Exceptional writing, interpersonal, and communication skills.
For candidates with more working experience, they may be considered for more senior position

Job Description:
At REACH Senior Service, our core belief is every senior is valuable and able to live life to their fullest potential. At our Senior Centre Centre, we aim to build a community of care for seniors residing in Bukit Panjang by providing daycare and physiotherapy services to meet their physical and mental needs.

JOIN US and be part of a team that contributes to building a community of seniors that improves mutual social cohesion, empowers the seniors, and maintains their health and mental wellness.
You are responsible for the clinical safety and well-being of all clients in the centre as well as the care environment. You will oversee and supervise the performance of tasks in care plans by care team members and provides input in developing and reviewing care plans with the social service and/or healthcare professionals. The supervision includes the administration, daily operations, and maintenance of the care environment and provides advice on measures to ensure clients observe house rules as well as mitigate risk to the elders.
You are also the primary assessor for admissions and referrals to the Senior Care Centre and the primary reviewer for care plans proposed by the care team and the rehab team.

Key Responsibilities:
 Assist in the efficient day-to-day operations of the centre, ensuring adherence to SOPs and policies, as well as relevant statutory requirements.
 Responsible for the preparation of MOH inspection, audits and licensing.
 Ensure clients welfare and safety through risk management.
 Perform intake assessment for all referrals and manage caregivers on admission procedures.
 Assist clients with financial aid applications and support schemes.
 Identify and implement operational improvements.
 Ensure efficient administration, compliance with regulations, and adherence to internal controls.
 Lead and supervise staff, ensure proper scheduling, and conduct regular meetings.
 Oversee staff development, training plans, and performance reviews.
 To liaise and maintain a positive network and relationship with stakeholders.

Requirements
 Possess a degree in social work.
 Minimum 3 years of relevant experience in managing a centre or facility
 Fully conversant in English and Mandarin, or any 2nd and 3rd language will be an advantage due to clients being seniors.
 Good communication, interpersonal and organisational skills
 Outgoing, energetic, self-motivated independent worker
 Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office Application
 Must be a good team-player, with a passion to work with seniors
 Only Singaporeans

Job Title: Stormwater Drainage Specialists Needed At Central
Job Description:
JOB PURPOSE
The Stormwater Drainage Specialists primary role is to assist the Operations Supervisor in the desilting and cleaning of any Stormwater drainage assets to the satisfaction of the Operations Supervisor.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Duties of this position include but are not limited to:
Highlight any possible safety risk before or while working to OS
Monitor and guide pedestrians away from drainage working area
Assist to carry out signalling duties for traffic where needed
Assist to cordon off any opening which may cause danger
Assist to deploy safety cones where needed
Clearing of resultant debris from drainage works
Operate high pressure jetting equipment
Operate mechanised equipment
Carry out desilting of various drainage assets
The job entails working outdoors for long hours in a physically challenging environment. The job also requires repetitive movement and the use of basic working tools to carry out the task assigned. There could be possible smell nuisance in some areas of work and the one could encounter debris deemed unpleasant and dirty. Some areas of works also require working in confined spaces and working at height.

Job Description:
Job Purpose
The School Nurse provides medical care for students throughout the school day, and oversees school wellness programs.

Start date: 27 November 2024

Job Duties and Responsibilities
Provide Nursing Care Services
Dispense prescription medications to students as per parents or doctors instructions / medical directives.
Provide basic first aid for minor injuries such as cuts, scrapes and bruises, and stabilising severely ill or injured students until parents, guardians or emergency services arrive;
Ensure a clear and smooth communication with the families and the team members.
Complete relevant nursing documentation.
Maintain and restock First Aid Kits
Manage School Wellness Program
Educate students on hygiene and safety practices.
Collect and analyse statistics using our record.
Organise meetings with the School Principal to follow-up on healthcare needs.
Participate and moderate educational team meetings to better assist special needs children, and liaise with the Special Needs support team of practitioners.
Participate in the organisation of protocols to deal with major emergencies occurring in the school.
Communicate with the canteen service to come up with balanced, healthy meals adapted to the children and follow-up weekly.
Conduct student hearing and vision screenings.
Verify vaccination records.
Daily Routine Duties
Communicate and coordinate with the school cleaners and classroom assistants to ensure that they are adequately equipped and informed on hygiene and safety practices.
Record student absences, communicate with families in case of a childs absence, finding out the reasons, thus getting a better visibility of the potential diseases in the school.
If while carrying out the duties of the role, the job holder identifies any instance that a child is suffering or likely to suffer significant harm either at school or at home, s/he must report any concerns to the School Principal so that a referral can be made accordingly to the relevant third-party services.

Job Competencies
Standard clinical skills to dispense medications and treat minor ailments and injuries
Adequate math skills to ensure proper dosage amounts when dispensing medications
Good communication skills to work with students and parents
Ability to demonstrate a calm, caring demeanour when working with children
Good presentation skills for training school staff
Ability to remain focused in the event of a student medical emergency.
Job Key Relationships
Line managed by School Principal
Liaise with School Principal, pedagogical team, and other support team members
Liaise with parents, guardians, and other external parties like Special Needs healthcare practitioners, ambulance paramedics, enrichment activities providers etc.
Required Qualifications and Desired Attributes
Must have completed a minimum of 1,000 hours of clinical experience or three years of academic experience.
A minimum of 2 years of experience as a school nurse is preferred; experience with young children will be considered a plus.
Fluency in English, bilingual in French and English is preferred, but not a must.
Desired attributes:
Kind, benevolent, and reassuring, able to listen to the childrens needs and attend to their well-being.
Results-driven and resourceful, with a strong affinity for critical thinking, hands-on execution, and problem-solving
Self-directed and able to work without supervision
Excellent team-player
Dynamic and proactive
Diligence
Working Conditions
Workplace
Most time on La Petite Ecole campus site, when needed or required, off site on school functions, excursions, meetings, events, and professional development.
Work Time
Monday to Thursday: from 8am until 5pm
Friday: from 8am until 4pm
Attending the team meetings in the week prior to back-to-school day.

Job Description:
Responsibilities:

1. Leadership & Management
Oversees the day-to-day operations of multiple dormitories
Leads and manages a team of dormitory staff, including recruitment, training, and performance management
Develops and enforces operational policies and procedures to ensure optimal management
2. Operational Oversight
Ensures compliance with all applicable regulations and conformance to organizational standards
Ensures facilities are well-maintained through regulation inspections and preventive maintenance
Coordinates with external vendors and service providers for timely repairs and services
Manages bed space allocation to optimize occupancy in accordance to organizational policies
3. Resident Services
Fosters a positive living environment by addressing resident needs and concerns promptly
Develops and implements programs and initiatives to promote the resident well-being
Oversees the resolution of conflicts and issues within the dormitory community
4. Financial Management
Prepares and manages budgets for dormitory operations
Monitors financial performance and implements cost-control measures
Manages financial records and ensures timely collection of payments
5. Compliance & Safety
Ensures adherence to health, safety, and security protocols
Develops emergency response plans and conducts regular safety drills
Maintains compliance with local and national regulations
6. Community Engagement
Promotes a sense of community among residents through organized events and activitiesActs as a liaison between the dormitory residents and other authorities / agencies
7. Reporting & Analysis
Prepares regular reports on operational performance, resident satisfaction, and financial status
Analyses operational data to identify improvement areas and implement strategic changes

Requirements:
Bachelors degree in Building/Real Estate/Facilities Management or any other related field
Minimum of 10 years of experience in a managerial role, preferably in residential or property management
Demonstrated leadership and team management abilities
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Advantageous with strong knowledge in FEDA Licencing requirement
Capable of managing emergencies and stressful situations effectively

Seatrium (SG) Pte. Ltd.
Acacia Lodge
530 - 540 Bukit Batok Street 23, Singapore 659548
Mon - Thu: 8.00am - 5.15pm

Job Description:
This role requires highly cross functional interactions with key site functions to ensure success in production and release performance. Individual must be able to effectively communicate and collaborate closely with the team members and various SME to ensure equipment are operational to sustain daily operations, resolve operation challenges and implement effective measures to address the challenges to ensure without compromising on safety and compliance.

Location: Tuas
Salary up to $10000
1 Year Contract

Design & Project Engineering:
Support NPI and Site projects as Engineering Technical Lead or Subject matter experts for process equipment
Provide technical expertise in site selection assessment to identify equipment/facility gaps, select new equipment, assess layout/utilities capacity and partner project managers to develop project cost and schedule.
Lead F&E to participate in technical transfer activities and cross-functional meetings.
Work independently and/or with project managers to complete engineering projects of various scales within schedule, budget and quality constraints.
Effectively manage and work with project CQV team to ensure timely delivery of projects.
Prompt updates or escalation of issues and challenges
Responsible for commissioning and qualification activities including FAT, SAT, PSSR, automation checkouts, IQ, OQ, PQ, and asset/preventive maintenance/spare parts creation for new process equipment.
Participate in the system walk-down, ensure the closure of punch items and support the takeover of the system from the project team
Work closely with project managers to introduce new equipment including development of business case, project charter, user requirement specifications, quality risk assessments, conceptual design, preliminary design, design specifications and detail design.
Participate in design review and setup up of new asset and associated maintenance plan/spares in Maximo.
Work with research, manufacturing, process development, utilities, facilities, quality assurance and validation departments in developing requirements and recommendations for large and/or highly complex system/facility modifications.
Work with project managers to complete design and engineering projects within schedule, budget and quality constraints.
Develop technical solutions to complex problems requiring the regular use of ingenuity and creativity.
Daily Operations
Accountability and ownership of assigned equipment
Subject matter expert for process equipment performance and operation to ensure safety, compliance and sustained operation
Effectively communicate and collaborate with cross function stakeholders to address operational challenges and concerns to ensure sustained operation and minimal interruptions to operations activities.
Lead and participate in equipment breakdown investigations to identify root causes. Effectively communicate to the customers on the subsequent plans, short term, and long-term mitigating actions.
Collaborate closely with cross functional SME to implement effective corrective, preventive action and improvements to eliminate or mitigate future recurrence.
Ensure operation continuity through asset lifecycle management planning, assess and identify impact to safety, compliance, operational schedule and cost.
Perform assessment for equipment during new product introduction, change controls and other qualifications activities to ensure equipment are in its validated state.
Accountable for deviation/change control associated to process equipment performance.
Responsible for investigation of deviations, development of corrective and preventive actions
and implementation of change controls in a timely manner.
Support equipment readiness initiatives for New Product Introduction or Product Campaign Changeover
Responsible for operation and reliability of Biotechnology process equipment and/or single use systems assigned.
Apply process equipment knowledge to perform troubleshooting of equipment failures/malfunctions and the development of technical assessments during normal working hours and after hours when required.
Develop, implement and optimize maintenance and reliability activities such as preventive maintenance, job plan and datasheet development in Maximo.
Apply knowledge of Operational Excellence practices such as lean maintenance to drive continuous improvement.
Responsible for completion of process equipment periodic review, data integrity assessment and security assessment in a timely manner
Collect, organize, analyze and present results for operational issues or engineering projects of various scale and complexity.

responsibilities

Supports the implementation and execution of the Infection Prevention and Control Program, including but not limited to the following:
Identifies, investigates, and reports healthcare facility onset infections, outbreaks, clusters and risk of infection among patients, staff and equipment through ongoing surveillance and rounds.

Takes on additional responsibilities or tasks as assigned by the Chairperson, Infection Control Committee and / or Head, Nursing.

Job Description:
Salary: up to $6000
Working Days & Hours: Mon-Fri Office Hours
Location: Kent Ridge

Job Description:
Primary Responsibilities
Inpatient CRP (Cardiac Wards)
 Identify patients through proactive screening daily.
 Assesses, plans, implements and evaluates, conducts counselling and teaching for patients and their families/caregiver.
 Provides patient/family information and education on disease process, causes of disease conditions, health education on risk factors, nutritional counselling, smoking cessation advice, exercise & coping strategies at home following discharge.
 Ongoing collaboration among patient, family and a multidisciplinary team to provide valuable connections.
 Refer patients to various need or department accordingly (e.g. Dietician/ Physiotherapist/ Smoking Cessation Counsellor)
 Screen, coordinate selection and recruitment of patient into the outpatient Cardiac Rehabilitation Programme (CRP)
 Schedules outpatient Pre-Rehab Assessment Clinic follow-up appointments when appropriate

Outpatient CRP (Heart Rehab)  Clinical
 Referral can be from heart clinics, wards, self-referral, etc.
 Triage the referral, contact patient for more information, ensure correct referral to appropriate exercise rehab program with sufficient time allocation for patients visit to respectively physician/therapist appointment booking.
 Check and highlight clinic / CRP orientation appointment list for enrolled patients.
 Coordinate and assist in Pre-Rehab Assessment clinic and schedule Post Rehab Clinic at the end of the program with post program parameter.
 Input the information into the Rehab Clinic database
 Assume responsibility for data collection and entry into CRP database system.
 Coordinate patients access and treatment sequence where required for the specialty.
 Tele-care to reschedule patients appointment date when defaulted outpatient follow up

Outpatient CRP (Heart Rehab)  Patient Education
 Conducts nurse-led specialty education session for patients and their families.
 Plans, implements, and evaluates in-service talks and specialty training courses based on unit and individual training needs
 Ensures patient education and counselling is carried out according to established standards of care and practice using the approved teaching materials.
 Applies understanding of prevention of medico-legal issues in relation to patient education.
 Assists to review and develop patient education materials in consultation with doctors and paramedical staff.

Outpatient CRP (Heart Rehab)  Operations
 Ensure daily operations of these service points, including administrative/operational matters and partnering Clinic Manager to solve system and process problems.
 Handle purchase, work requisition processes and calling suppliers for quotation.
 Ensure sufficient supply of related educational material / stationery requisition and other equipment maintenance are maintained.
 Updates and maintains patient consultation/CRP training statistics and CRP support group.

Secondary Responsibilities
 Acts as a resource person to nurses, nurse manager / nurse clinician on matters and issues for the specialty.
 Assist and coordinate hospital educational talks and external talks / workshops / forums / seminars.
 Participates in quality improvement / research projects.
 Participates in training /quality improvement / research committees.
 Assume any additional responsibilities as assigned.

Job Requirements: Min Degree in Nursing w min 1-2 years relevant experience in Cardiac ward settings
