Job Description:
Manage and maintain the validated status of the EAMS maintenance management system by working with Quality Assurance team, Automation Information team, E/I maintenance team and vendor, on the data base, software and hardware validation.
Manage and supervise a team of Calibration/E&I Technicians to perform instrument calibration and instrument maintenance activities (CAL, COR, and repairs) according to procedures, good engineering practices and cGMP.
Perform day-to-day planning and scheduling instrument calibration and instrument maintenance activities to ensure smooth production.
Develop instrument calibration and instrument maintenance program to maintain plant instrument assets. Review and modify the PM Calibration to improve instrumentation, control and reliability.
Be the System Administrator /SuperUser on EAMS applications and conduct training to new user(s).
Manage and utilize the EAMS as an effective tool to support the calibration team in compliance with cGMP and good maintenance practices.
Maintain the quality and accuracy of data integrity of the EAMS system.
Support manager to achieve financial objectives by preparing and controlling against approved annual maintenance budget; scheduling expenditures; analyzing variances; initiating corrective actions for instrumentation, control and repairs.
Lead/participate in continuous improvement initiatives and support (IRS/QAR) investigations.
Manage and maintain calibration Standard Operation Procedure (SOP) by generating procedures for the operation, review procedures, optimize procedures and training of procedures to the E/I calibration team.
Manage and execute any modification and control of the calibration system in compliance with cGMP and good maintenance practices.
Track instrument performance and conduct bench marking by tracking instrument breakdown, re-occurrence failure and instrument history report to enable Maintenance Team to focus on areas that required attention.
Provide relevant operation and performance reports by generating reports on instrument maintenance work/PM statistics.
Support maintenance operations and shutdown activities by working with Supervisor and Engineer on developing the annual PM plan, setting work priorities; scheduling PM activities, coordinating and resources planning to meet the schedule in cost-effective way.
Implement and maintain calibration record filing system by keeping all calibration documentation records and reports for fast retrieval, audit ready and comply to cGMP requirement.
Work with E/I Supervisor and Maintenance Planner to enhance maintenance activities on Global Reliability Program (GRP) / Preventive Maintenance Optimization (PMO).
Coordinate between the E/I and Production team; Area owners and Maintenance Repair & Operation (MRO) store on shutdown activities and major maintenance jobs, plan and schedule calibration/PM work orders accordingly.
Work with E/I Supervisor and Maintenance Planner on updating the Key Performance Index (KPI) established.
Liaise with Production to support new product tech-transfer, project construction and commissioning through active involvement in commissioning activities; discuss instruments hardware improvement and modifications.
Maintaining good working relations with team by working closely with E/I, Automation, Production and vendor in consultation with the team to resolve any issues.
Support Project team on special / urgent assigned projects to meet the requirement, schedule and budget target.
Maintain a safe and clean working environment on areas under ones responsibility.
Provide training (e.g. OJT) and coaching to colleagues to build-up their competencies.
Participate IMEx Process Centric Team Tier 1 meetings and address engineering issues based on priority.
Develop or support TPM-OPC checklists, train and coach operation team in OPC tasks and knowledge.
Complete all assigned training on-time and also prior to work execution.
Contribute to team effort by accomplishing desired results/KPIs.
Job Requirements: Min Degree in Engineering with minimum 10 years of relevant experiences in pharmaceutical, chemical, or petrochemical industries.

Job Title: Aesthetics Doctor  Perceptorship & Bond Transfer Scheme Provided
Job Description:
Job Overview
Competitive Remuneration: Monthly salary package ranges between $25,000 to $35,000.
Working Schedule: up to 5 work day per week
Training: Comprehensive and structured preceptorship training led by senior doctors and our Medical Director with extensive experience in aesthetic dermatology.
Opportunity Overview:
Join Our Team and Shape the Future of the Medical-Aesthetics Industry! ClearSK manages the award-winning ClearSK chain of medi-aesthetic centres with presence in Singapore, Shanghai, Hangzhou and Kuala Lumpur. As a Singapore leading aesthetics and healthcare chain, it will be a great opportunity for you to grow and learn in a multi-disciplinary environment with medical and management professionals. You will find yourself working in a challenging environment, where your capabilities will be developed to the maximum potential. To fit in with our culture of excellence, we look for only the F.I.T.: Fast, Innovative and Trainable as well as commitment, integrity and professional skills.
Reasons to Join Us:
Receive structured training under the guidance of our senior doctors and Medical Director who has 20 years of aesthetic dermatology medical experience, designed to equip you with the essential skills for aesthetic procedures. No prior experience in aesthetics is required.
Junior doctors currently under MOHH are welcome, offering flexibility in terms of career progression. For those who excel in an aesthetics-focused practice, further details on our MOH bond transfer scheme will be discussed during the interview process.
Very Competitive remuneration packages are available, monthly salary ranging from $25,000 to $35,000.
Up to 5-day work week only.
We are one of the earliest established medical aesthetic group in Singapore with clinics all around Singapore.
ClearSK is committed to the ongoing professional development of its staff, offering sponsorship for relevant aesthetic courses and conferences.
Overseas assignment opportunities for strong performers.
Responsibilities:
Report to the Director of Operations and Medical Director.
Conduct professional skin & body consultations, tailoring treatment plans based on individual needs.
Collaborate with healthcare professionals to optimize treatment outcomes.
Administer medical-grade aesthetic treatments.
Record patient feedback and adapt treatment plans for improved clinical results.
Collaborate with management and clinic staff to achieve organizational goals.
Contribute to research & development, including developing new treatment programs and training materials.
Requirements:
Full registration with the Singapore Medical Council.
A tertiary degree in medicine from a recognized institution
Attainment of relevant Certificate of Competence (COC)
Prior experience in dermatology and aesthetics is advantageous but not mandatory.
Strong interpersonal skills, including effective communication and a positive outlook.
Proficient in English communication and writing.
Ability to read, write, and converse in Chinese will be an added advantage as liaising with our counterparts in China and Chinese customers.
Qualified candidates are offered an attractive remuneration and benefits package aligned with their experience and qualifications.
Application process:
Should you wish to be considered for shortlisting, please complete the attached Google Form at the link below prior to submitting your application on MyCareersFuture:
https://forms.gle/ZdnDCJYqZ916n8iQ7
Please be advised that only candidates who have completed the form and are subsequently shortlisted will be notified.
ClearSK is an equal opportunity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply.

Job Description:
The Veterinarian (Emergency Room) will deliver the highest quality veterinary care and an exceptional client experience. S/he advocates for pets and their quality of life; builds a long term bonding relationship with clients; contributes to the development and maintenance of the human-pet bond; educates clients and clinic associates on all aspects of pet health; mentors and develops an efficient, collaborative and productive veterinary medical team; and improves both the medical quality and business performance of the hospita.
Live and exemplify the Five Principles of Mars, Inc. within self and team.
Deliver the highest level of veterinary care to every pet in a professional and ethical manner while ensuring the client and their pet have an exceptional experience.
Establish trust and gain the confidence and compliance of clients through effectively delivering appropriate preventive care, performing complete diagnostic workups, developing thorough treatment plans, communicating home care instructions, and planning follow-up visits.
Advocate for preventive care and adoption of wellness plans.
Assimilate information gathered through effective history taking, physical examination and diagnostic workup to arrive at an appropriate and effective clinical decision.
Lead veterinary team through the daily schedule and caseloads, delegating tasks to paraprofessionals and improving hospital efficiency.
Practice veterinary medicine in a manner compliant with the Animal & Veterinary Service and VES Hospital Code of Conduct and Ethics, along with appropriate medical record documentation.
Address and resolve client concerns arising from the medical care of their pet/s.
Collaborate harmoniously with clinic team, peers, leaders and Mars associates, enjoying being a member of the larger veterinary community/profession;
Develop strong lasting relationships with clients.
Partner with field and clinic leadership to design a career development plan which may include medical, surgical, communication and leadership skills.
Strive to achieve performance metrics outlined by medical and field leadership.
Demonstrate integrity and ethics in all actions and behaviors.
Practice evidence-based medicine and preventive care when data or guidelines exist, using sound judgment when they do not.
Perform all basic surgeries with appropriate anesthesia, monitoring and pain management.
Educate clients and clinic associates to improve their level of knowledge about veterinary care and husbandry.
Charge for services rendered and products/prescriptions dispensed.
Constantly strives to enhance medical quality, clinic efficiency and profitability.
Other assigned duties.
Write to us at MVHAsiaTalent@effem.com if you meet the following criterias:
Doctor of Veterinary Medicine (DVM/VMD) or equivalent degree required.
Veterinary license in good standing or eligibility for licensure with the applicable veterinary board.
Minimum of five years relevant professional veterinarian experience in a pet clinic or hospital environment within emergency services.
Independent, self-motivated, capable to meet tight timeline.
Attention to details and accuracy with strong sense of urgency.
Ability to handle multi-tasks and respond effectively to ad-hoc requests.
Good stakeholder management skills and strong interpersonal and communication skills.

Job Description:
Responsibilities:
Technical support working closely with senior staff and Project Managers
Technical working knowledge of flora and botany, vegetation and habitat classifications, and ecosystem dynamics within Singapore and/or SE Asia.
Contributing to environmental projects and business growth in Singapore, SE Asia, and Asia (depending project opportunities) on technical aspects of one or more of the following: Biodiversity Impact Assessment (BIA), Environmental Maintenance and Management Plans (EMMP), Environmental Baseline Studies (EBS) including biodiversity baselining or monitoring etc. Ability to work on a combination of these services will be highly regarded.
Participate/ experienced in biodiversity surveys with a key emphasis on flora, ID species on site, experienced biodiversity impact assessments, sustainability reporting TNFD etc.
Have a keen interest and knowledge base in Nature Positive approaches, habitat restoration and habitat offsetting.
Contributing to project presentations and client meetings with senior staff and Project Managers.
Business development support for current and prospective clients.
Comply with quality management on all work products.
Task budgeting and scheduling control.
Coordinating with stakeholders, sub-consultants and other disciplines, as necessary.
Requirements:
Masters degree in Ecology, Environmental Science, Environmental Management, Nature Conservation, Nature Based Solutions or other related disciplines (e.g., civil engineering and environmental engineering) OR Bachelors degree plus equivalent years of experience in the environmental field.
3-7 years of relevant experience in ecological consultancy, environmental engineering, environmental planning or environmental management sector. Qualified applicants will be considered for senior positions.
Ability to use modeling software/s will be highly regarded.
Candidates with graphic skills such as CAD or GIS, will be highly regarded.
Candidates with proven project management ability will be highly regarded.
Fluent spoken and written English.
Strong communication skills (writing, speaking, and presentation) are essential qualities to successfully work on our teams with diverse disciplines and cultures.

Job Description:
Key Roles & Responsibilities
The Snr Executive / Asst Manager will support the Vice President (Systems and Quality Assurance) in implementing and managing the Company's Excel QA framework, School Management Model (SMM) Knowledge Repository, EduTrust compliance and data protection across the organisation.

Company's Framework & SMM Knowledge Repository

EduTrust Compliance & Support

2. Assist in reviewing EduTrust-related documents.

Data Protection Compliance
1. Assist in the development and implementation of data protection policies and procedures.
2. Support in conducting data protection risk assessments and audits across all schools.
3. Monitor compliance with data protection laws and regulations and report findings to the Group DPO.
4. Coordinate data protection training and awareness programmes for staff.
5. Maintain comprehensive records of data processing activities and assist in the preparation of reports on data protection compliance.

 Recognised bachelors degree in Education, Business Administration, Quality Management, or a related field.

 Knowledge of quality/compliance management systems and frameworks (e.g., EduTrust, ISO 21001) is essential.

 Strong analytical skills and attention to detail, with an aptitude for data review and analysis.

 Passion for education and school improvement.

Other Professional Qualifications

Job Description:
Why Patients Need You
Whether you are involved in the design and development of manufacturing processes for products or supporting maintenance and reliability, engineering is vital to making sure customers and patients have the medicines they need, when they need them. Working with our innovative engineering team, you'll help bring medicines to the world even faster by imagining whats possible and taking action.
What You Will Achieve
Working with Pfizers dynamic engineering team, you will play a critical role in developing and modifying process formulations, methods and controls to meet quality standards. Your production engineering skills will help in recommending and implementing improvements, modifications or additions that will help in solving problems. You will review product requirements in terms of product development compatibility and help Pfizer determine optimum costs and schedules of production.
As a Senior Associate, your knowledge and skills will contribute towards the goals and objectives of the team. Your focus and ability to meet team targets will help in completing critical deliverables. Your innovative use of communication tools and techniques will facilitate in explaining difficult issues and establishing consensus between teams.
It is your hard work and dedication that will make Pfizer ready to achieve new milestones and help patients across the globe.
Position summary
Senior Process Engineer serves as a member of new product introduction team will be responsible for leading product manufacturing campaigns from the start of production, providing technical supervision with respect to quality and EHS until completion and release of the material.
The core role of this position is responsible to work with various stakeholders to assess the robustness of transferring processes and analytical methods to successful completion of New Product Introduction (NPI) technical transfer project, with associated risk reduced to an acceptable level.
Position responsibilities
Process Engineering
Develop Manufacturing / Operating Instructions and necessary Standard Operating Procedures.
Develop, maintain and troubleshoot the process control system recipe / models.
Carry out technical assessment for evaluation of processes.
Investigate, report and troubleshoot findings on both quality and EHS related issues observed during manufacturing or during batch record review.
Develop, implement and monitor robust preventive measures for processing issues.
Play a pro-active role in ensuring the site safety and quality standards are adhered to.
Proactively monitor, identify, develop and implement improvements in processes and equipment.
Communicate on a regular basis to the plant personnel on process updates.
Train the process technicians on the process and procedures as required.
Own one or more multiple equipment / GMP systems in production and present the system overview with evidence compliance to internal and external auditors.
Organizational relationships
Internal: Engineering, Process, Technical Services, Quality Operations
External: Sending Site Subject Matter Experts
Qualifications
Must-Have
Degree in engineering, preferably chemical engineering pr degree in science with major in chemistry.
3+ years of experience in a relevant manufacturing environment
Core competencies
Process Engineering and Technical Knowledge
Strong sense of commitment and dedication, with sense of urgency to get things done and results-drive attitude.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written
Strong team player, adaptable and versatile with the ability to work across different cultures.

Job Description:
Why Patients Need You
Whether you are involved in the design and development of manufacturing processes for products or supporting maintenance and reliability, engineering is vital to making sure customers and patients have the medicines they need, when they need them. Working with our innovative engineering team, you'll help bring medicines to the world even faster by imagining whats possible and taking action.
What You Will Achieve
Working with Pfizers dynamic engineering team, you will play a critical role in the management of manufacturing information systems to improve manufacturing success rates and ensuring zero down time.
As a Senior Associate, your knowledge and skills will contribute towards the goals and objectives of the team. Your focus and ability to meet team targets will help in completing critical deliverables. Your innovative use of communication tools and techniques will facilitate in explaining difficult issues and establishing consensus between teams.
It is your hard work and dedication that will make Pfizer ready to achieve new milestones and help patients across the globe.
How You Will Achieve It
Manage and maintain the validated status of the EAMS maintenance management system by working with Quality Assurance team, Automation Information team, E/I maintenance team and vendor, on the data base, software and hardware validation.
Manage and supervise a team of Calibration/E&I Technicians to perform instrument calibration and instrument maintenance activities (CAL, COR, and repairs) according to procedures, good engineering practices and cGMP.
Perform day-to-day planning and scheduling instrument calibration and instrument maintenance activities to ensure smooth production.
Develop instrument calibration and instrument maintenance program to maintain plant instrument assets. Review and modify the PM Calibration to improve instrumentation, control and reliability.
Be the System Administrator /SuperUser on EAMS applications and conduct training to new user(s).
Manage and utilize the EAMS as an effective tool to support the calibration team in compliance with cGMP and good maintenance practices.
Maintain the quality and accuracy of data integrity of the EAMS system.
Support manager to achieve financial objectives by preparing and controlling against approved annual maintenance budget; scheduling expenditures; analyzing variances; initiating corrective actions for instrumentation, control and repairs.
Lead/participate in continuous improvement initiatives and support (IRS/QAR) investigations.
Manage and maintain calibration Standard Operation Procedure (SOP) by generating procedures for the operation, review procedures, optimize procedures and training of procedures to the E/I calibration team.
Manage and execute any modification and control of the calibration system in compliance with cGMP and good maintenance practices.
Track instrument performance and conduct bench marking by tracking instrument breakdown, re-occurrence failure and instrument history report to enable Maintenance Team to focus on areas that required attention.
Provide relevant operation and performance reports by generating reports on instrument maintenance work/PM statistics.
Support maintenance operations and shutdown activities by working with Supervisor and Engineer on developing the annual PM plan, setting work priorities; scheduling PM activities, coordinating and resources planning to meet the schedule in cost-effective way.
Implement and maintain calibration record filing system by keeping all calibration documentation records and reports for fast retrieval, audit ready and comply to cGMP requirement.
Work with E/I Supervisor and Maintenance Planner to enhance maintenance activities on Global Reliability Program (GRP) / Preventive Maintenance Optimization (PMO).
Coordinate between the E/I and Production team; Area owners and Maintenance Repair & Operation (MRO) store on shutdown activities and major maintenance jobs, plan and schedule calibration/PM work orders accordingly.
Work with E/I Supervisor and Maintenance Planner on updating the Key Performance Index (KPI) established.
Liaise with Production to support new product tech-transfer, project construction and commissioning through active involvement in commissioning activities; discuss instruments hardware improvement and modifications.
Maintaining good working relations with team by working closely with E/I, Automation, Production and vendor in consultation with the team to resolve any issues.
Support Project team on special / urgent assigned projects to meet the requirement, schedule and budget target.
Maintain a safe and clean working environment on areas under ones responsibility.
Provide training (e.g. OJT) and coaching to colleagues to build-up their competencies.
Participate IMEx Process Centric Team Tier 1 meetings and address engineering issues based on priority.
Develop or support TPM-OPC checklists, train and coach operation team in OPC tasks and knowledge.
Complete all assigned training on-time and also prior to work execution.
Contribute to team effort by accomplishing desired results/KPIs.
Qualifications
Must-Have
Degree / Diploma in Engineering related qualifications. Minimum 10 years of relevant experiences in pharmaceutical, chemical, or petrochemical industries.Other Job Related Requirements:
Good working knowledge of CMS application, CGMP, GMI strategies and PMO concept.
Knowledge of Reliability Maintenance, Right First Time technique and performance base management.
Experience in a large, global and complex organization would be an advantage
Able to handle multiple projects concurrently and possess project management experience
Able to influence stakeholders or Business Leaders and to build trust throughout the organization
Demonstrated capability to thrive in a complex and matrix environment
Able to work with ambiguity
Demonstrated problem-solving and relationship management skills
Demonstrated consultative skills
Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication
Knowledge of cGMP and regulatory requirement related to instrument validation.
Good interpersonal skills and meticulous in producing quality output.
Proven teamwork and problem solving ability, customer focus and commitment to continuous improvement.
Ability to work effectively across functional teams and at multiple-levels within the organization.
Nice-to-Have
Master's degree
Understanding of programming, and proficiency in at least one language

Company's Framework & SMM Knowledge Repository
1. Assist in the development, management, and implementation of the SingEdExcel framework across schools.
2. Support the Vice President in monitoring, reviewing, and evaluating the effectiveness of the framework and the knowledge repository.
3. Coordinate with school leaders and staff to ensure effective adoption and implementation of standardised policies and procedures.
4. Maintain documentation of all policies and procedures, ensuring they are up-to-date and accessible in the knowledge repository.
5. Assist in organising professional learning sessions for school leaders on the SingEdExcel framework and SMM Knowledge Repository.

EduTrust Compliance & Support
1. Support the Vice President in serving as an internal assessor for schools preparing for EduTrust certification.
2. Assist in reviewing EduTrust-related documents.
3. Coordinate and manage documentation and evidence gathering for the EduTrust certification renewal exercise.

Data Protection Compliance
1. Assist in the development and implementation of data protection policies and procedures.
2. Support in conducting data protection risk assessments and audits across all schools.
3. Monitor compliance with data protection laws and regulations and report findings to the Group DPO.
4. Coordinate data protection training and awareness programmes for staff.
5. Maintain comprehensive records of data processing activities and assist in the preparation of reports on data protection compliance.

Job Specification
 Recognised bachelors degree in Education, Business Administration, Quality Management, or a related field.
 Minimum of 3 years of experience in quality assurance, compliance management, or a related field.
 Minimum of 1 year of experience with data protection and privacy laws, and their implementation in organisational processes.
 Knowledge of quality/compliance management systems and frameworks (e.g., EduTrust, ISO 21001) is essential.
 Experience with quality improvement initiatives and system implementation is highly regarded.
 Strong analytical skills and attention to detail, with an aptitude for data review and analysis.
 Prior experience in the education industry is preferred.
 Proficiency in Micros

Profile of Competency
 Excellent communication skills.
 Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
 Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
 Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
 Commitment to continuous improvement.
 Passion for education and school improvement.
 Understanding of local and regional data protection laws and best practices.
 Ability to manage and implement data protection projects within set timelines and budgets.
 Commitment to maintaining the highest levels of integrity and confidentiality.

Other Professional Qualifications
 Completion of relevant training programmes in data protection and/or privacy laws.
 Any additional certifications in quality management or project management will be beneficial.

Industry: Education / International schools
Working hours: 8.30am to 5.30pm / Mon-Fri

Job Description:
Description:
Provide and facilitate socio-economic evaluations to help patients and their families address practical concerns, such as financial matters, which are often an issue at the end of life
On-going individual and family counselling through face-to-face sessions or home visitations in order to help navigate the personal and ethical dilemma, cultural conflict and issue relating to religion, spirituality and the meaning of life
Work with the broader community which includes educational, religious, and social service organizations so that patients and their families can achieve optimal end of life goals
Engage families involvement and encourages their visits, as well as prepares patients / families for the end-of-life stage and managing the life closure and the dying process
Attend Interdisciplinary Patient Care Conferences with medical, nursing, allied health teams to discuss plans for total management of the patient
Counsel patients and their family members on financial and discharge care plans
Perform field work involving visiting patients in hospital wards and other social agencies to help patients alleviate or resolve their medico-social problems
Prepare social and other related reports for management and other related institutions / agencies
Present cases for discussion and engages actively on formal platforms such as departmental or inter-departmental meetings for the purpose of sharing, reviewing and clarifying of atypical, difficult issues
Undertake highly complex case arrangement
Document all social interventions for record, within the expected time frame set by the department
Provide formal clinical supervision and provides expert opinion when consulted
Requirements:
Min. Degree in Social Work
Min 2 to 3 years of social worker experience

Job Description:
Job Scope
Support the shift operation in all activities, ensuring that it is meets all environmental, health and safety regulations.
Support the STS in ensuring that all operation and maintenance activities are in compliance to the safety procedures for Lock out/Tag out, energy control procedures, line breaking activities, confine space entry, work at height, hot and cold work permitting.

Assign operation task according to Manufacturing Standard Work (MSW) and Operation Standard Work (OSW)
Participate in all troubleshooting activities in processing issues, deviations and coordinating with other functions when require immediate and preventive actions.
Participate in all investigation, report and troubleshoot findings on both EHS and quality related issues observed during manufacturing or during batch record review.
Participate in Continuous Improvement (CI) activities, contribute ideas and perform Plan, Do, Check, Action (PDCA) cycle
Support the STS in the development of risk assessment, creation of job safety assessment and participate in HAZOP when required.
Develop Standard Operating Procedures as part of change control and perform periodic review.
Assist in all commissioning, qualification and validation activities as necessary.
Participate as a member of the emergency response team (ERT) when necessary.

Requirement
Degree in Engineering, preferably in Chemical Engineering or Degree in Science
Demonstrated ability to lead people or processes
Laboratory experience required (testing, data reviewing, or other supporting activities for laboratory operation)
Basic functional and technical knowledge of the discipline
Good organization skills and attention to detail
Ability to document clearly and concisely

Description
Chiropractic First Group is the leading chiropractic group with over 35 clinics in Asia and Europe, and is rapidly expanding. We have 13 clinic locations in Singapore, and we are looking for active and service-oriented team player to join us as Patient Service Associate / Clinic Assistant.

 Immediate Vacancies

Job Description:
Overview:The Healthcare Operations Manager is responsible for managing the operational aspects of healthcare facilities or organizations.

Key Responsibilities:

1. Strategic Planning: Manage the operational strategies aligned with the overall healthcare organization's goals. Collaborate with executive leadership to ensure operational plans support the long-term vision of the healthcare facility.
2. Process Optimization:Identify and implement process improvement initiatives to enhance the efficiency of healthcare operations.
3. Resource Management: Manage and ensure that the allocation and utilization of resources, including staff, budget, and equipment, ensure optimal efficiency and effectiveness.
4. Quality Assurance: Assist in implementing quality assurance programs to ensure the delivery of high-quality patient care.
5. Team Leadership: Provide leadership and guidance to operational teams, fostering a positive and collaborative work environment. Assist in conducting regular performance evaluations, provide feedback.
6. Interdepartmental Collaboration: Collaborate with other departments, including clinical and administrative teams, to enhance communication and coordination of care.
7. Emergency Preparedness: Assist in managing the emergency preparedness plans to ensure the healthcare facility can respond effectively to crises or disasters.

Qualifications:
Degree in healthcare administration, or a related field.
Preferably with experience in healthcare industry
Knowledge of healthcare regulations, accreditation standards, and industry best practices.
Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to adapt to a dynamic healthcare environment and drive positive change.

Job Title: Internship: Sales Assistant For Api  Active Pharmaceutical Ingredient
Job Description:
Apollo Healthcare Resources (Register No.: 53187249A, Website: www.apollo-healthcare.com.sg) was established in March 2011. It is now the most comprehensive Active Pharmaceutical Ingredient (API) and Excipient distributor in Singapore. We carry over 1000 products for Pharmaceutical, Personal Care and Food industries.

Youll help us meet and surpass business expectations and contribute to our companys rapid and sustainable growth. Youll feel a sense of purpose, as we know our work improves the health of billions of patients.

The Sales Assistant (API) reports to the Director, as the essential point of contact between the existing & potential customers and our China purchasing team. This position will have complete training & guidance, a competitive salary, and better promotional possibilities.

Job Responsibilities:
1. Actively seek out new sales opportunities.
2. Conduct market research to identify selling possibilities and evaluate customer needs.
3. Collaborate with the China purchasing team to achieve better results.
4. Collect customer payment as needed and ensure timely resolution of any payment issues.
5. Negotiate/close deals and handle complaints or objections.

Job Requirements:
1. Strong interpersonal skills
2. A solid understanding of the business world, especially of the pharmaceutical (API) or chemical industry.
3. Good problem-solving abilities for solving tricky issues.
4. Maturity, confidence, and patience are vital attributes.
5. Fluency in Chinese is highly valued, as our purchasing team is based in China.

If you are interested in this job, please feel free to email your resume to: hr@apollo-healthcare.com.sg , hr<a>apollo-healthcare.com.sg .

Job Description:
Hazardous Waste/Material Disposal Manager shall have a Bachelors degree in Science, Environmental Science, Environmental Health, or Environmental Engineering and have completed a formal 40-hour training course in hazardous waste management.
Hazardous Waste/Material Disposal Manager shall have completed first aid training including cardio pulmonary respiratory (CPR) resuscitation certification.
The Hazardous Waste/Material Disposal Manager shall have intimate knowledge of local and U.S. hazardous waste regulations and hazardous substances transportation requirements, and have certification of Hazardous Waste Operations (HAZWOPER) training and forklift operations.
Shall have a minimum of two years of experience as the Hazardous Waste Coordinator for a Medium Quantity Generator as defined by 40 CFR, or as approved by Government Environmental.
The Manager shall serve as the emergency coordinator in the event of a spill or accident.
Personnel shall have at least five years of work experience performing spill assessment, containment and cleanup of oil or hazardous substance spills in industrial settings.
All spill response personnel, personnel handling, packaging or shipping HW/M shall successfully complete a program of classroom instruction or on-the-job training covering hazardous waste/material management as required by 40 CFR and 29 CFR.
All spill response personnel, personnel performing handling, packaging and shipping of HM/W for transportation shall successfully complete training covering 29 CFR commensurate with their duties. Training certificates shall be maintained and in each persons training folder together with qualification statement and job description. At a minimum, at least one employee shall be authorized to certify outgoing shipments of hazardous cargo material at all times. Training courses are offered by the Naval Supply Corp School in Athens, GA. This school certifies shippers for multi-modal shipments of hazardous material. Contact numbers are: (706) 354-7240, FAX: (706) 354-7280, e-mail address: www.nscs.com.
Hazardous Material (HM) and Hazardous Waste (HW) Personnel Responsible for eTracking or Signing Manifests: All personnel responsible for eTracking or signing manifests for HM or HW shall be certified by attending Hazardous Cargo Certification course IAW NAVSUP 505 and AFR 71-4. Certification is valid for two years, after which re-certification is required. The Contractor shall be responsible for the coordination of certification with NAVSUP FLC Site Singapore no later than 6 months prior to expiration.
Sampling Personnel:
All personnel who perform sampling shall have passed the Environmental Quality Sampling course offered by Naval Civil Engineer Corps Officers School (CECOS), or be approved by KO.

Job Description:
As a FUNCTIONAL ANALYST, you are expected to work in a high pace but fun, exciting and supportive environment and shall be constantly challenged to step out of your comfort zone, pioneer and try new ideas, acquire new skills and dabble in projects and pilot projects of different forms. Because of the multi-faceted role and myriad of exposures, you will have ample opportunities to try new things, attend professional courses/ workshops and work directly with end-users such as doctors, nurses, allied health professionals, etc. The boundaries to learning is only limited to the skills and potential of the individual.

Here are your primary duties:
Participate in the requirement study, research, feasibility study, functional analysis and design phases, functional testing, user acceptance testing and end-user training of any new IT software development projects and/ or product development for the eldercare industry
Perform technical and business impact analysis for modifications needed in existing web-based SaaS/SOA and bespoke applications to meet changing user requirements
Involve in market-driven Software/ SaaS product development, enhancement and roadmapping
Assist in troubleshooting software application and system issues
Work with Product Owners, Software Architects, Developers, Project Managers and customers/ end users (e.g. doctors, nurses, clinicians, administrators, IT Manager, etc.) on change requests and enhancements to current systems
Produce Functional Specification, User Story and Functional Test Case
Chance to participate in consulting and proof-of-concept/pilot and other trailblazing/ meaningful projects
Requirements:
Candidate must possess at least a Diploma, Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma in any field
3 solid years of relevant working experience, preferably working as business analyst, system analyst, product analyst, functional consultant, etc
Candidates should be versatile and independent in picking up new technology, and possess strong logical and analytical problem solving skills
Able to do flowcharting and business process analysis
Ability to grasp and understand business requirements
Enjoy solving real-world problems, applying new technology and creating new software/SaaS products
Good communication and interpersonal skills as you are expected to liaise/interface with customers/end-users (including doctors, nurses, social workers and healthcare professionals) regularly
Good documentation skills
Excellent professional and working attitude
Proficient with MS Office Applications (i.e. Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, Visio, etc)
Meticulous, good organizational and documentation skills

Note: Candidates who are more experienced may be considered for Senior Functional Analyst role.

Job Description:
Job Overview

The Contracts Manager will be responsible for managing the tendering process for various contracts, ensuring compliance with company policies and legal requirements. This role involves coordinating with multiple departments to develop and submit competitive and comprehensive tenders, negotiating terms and conditions, and overseeing the execution of contracts to ensure that all parties fulfill their obligations.

Job Responsibilities

1. Tender Management:
- Coordinate and manage the entire tender process from initial identification of opportunities through to contract award.
- Develop tender documents, proposals, and responses to requests for proposals (RFPs), requests for quotations (RFQs), and invitations to tender (ITTs).
- Ensure all tender submissions meet the client's specifications, company standards, and legal requirements.
2. Contract Development and Negotiation:
- Draft, review, and negotiate contract terms and conditions with clients, suppliers, and subcontractors.
- Ensure that contracts are in compliance with all applicable laws and regulations.
- Collaborate with legal counsel as necessary to address any legal issues or risks.
3. Stakeholder Coordination:
- Work closely with internal departments (e.g., finance, legal, procurement, project management) to gather necessary information and ensure alignment on tender submissions.
- Maintain clear communication with external stakeholders, including clients and suppliers, throughout the tendering process.
4. Risk Management:
- Identify and assess potential risks associated with contracts and propose mitigation strategies.
- Ensure that all contractual obligations are met and that any potential issues are addressed proactively.
5. Documentation and Reporting:
- Maintain comprehensive records of all tender submissions, contracts, and related documentation.
- Prepare regular reports on tendering activities, contract performance, and compliance for senior management.
6. Continuous Improvement:
- Evaluate and improve tendering processes and strategies to enhance competitiveness and efficiency.
- Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and regulatory changes related to contract management and tendering.

Qualifications
- Bachelors degree or diploma in Business Administration, Law or related field.
- Minimum of 5 years of experience in contract management, tendering, or a similar role.
- Strong understanding of contract law and regulations.
- Excellent negotiation, communication, and interpersonal skills.
- High attention to detail and strong organizational skills.
- Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
- Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and contract management software.

Preferred Skills
- Professional certification in contract management (e.g., CPCM, CFCM) or equivalent.
- Experience in the industry relevant to the company's operations (e.g., cleaning and/or landscape)
- Familiarity with project management principles and tools.

Working Conditions
- Full-time position based in the companys headquarters.
- Occasional travel may be required for meetings with clients or stakeholders.
- Fast-paced and deadline-driven environment.
skills: ['Tender Process', 'Interpersonal Skills', 'Contract Management', 'Administration', 'Procurement', 'Tender Submissions', 'Attention to Detail', 'Contract Law', 'Tender Management', 'Tendering', 'Legal Issues']

Job Description:
Doehle Shipmanagement Pte. Ltd., Singapore is seeking to recruit a Marine Superintendent to oversee the nautical operations of the companys fleet. The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring safety, environmental compliance and regulatory adherence across the vessels. With a growing fleet of nearly 20 container vessels, the Marine Superintendent will play a key role in maintaining operational efficiency and safety standards. Marine Superintendent Would you like to make a difference with us?

Your tasks and responsibilities:
 Oversee all nautical operations, ensuring regulatory compliance, cargo worthiness, navigational safety, and adherence to ISM, ISO, and QHSE standards.
 Handle cargo-related matters, including stowage, loading, securing, and stability, ensuring compliance with regulations and operational requirements.
 Monitor and approve nautical-related requisitions, assist in creating annual operating budgets, and track OPEX and budget performance alongside the Technical Superintendent.
 Liaise with classification societies, flag states, and regulatory bodies to ensure compliance, handling inspections, surveys, and any deficiencies promptly. Travelling to visit ships is part of your job scope.
 Brief, debrief, and appraise the Master and Chief Officer, identify training needs, and provide guidance on navigational and cargorelated matters.
 Handle insurance claims, conduct damage surveys, ensure timely recovery of receivables, monitor dry-docking specifications, and ensure the functionality of vessel communication systems in coordination with Fleet-IT.

Preferable qualifications and requirements:
 Proven experience as a Master Mariner or Chief Officer on Container and Bulk Carrier vessels, with strong operational and leadership capabilities.
 Familiarity with vetting processes, including Rightship and related maritime compliance requirements.
 Certified as a DPA, CSO, and Internal Auditor for ISM, ISPS, MLC, and other relevant maritime standards.
 Sound knowledge of ISM, ISPS, MLC, ISO 9001, 14001, 45001 standards
 Ability to apply analytical and critical thinking to ensure compliance, safety, and efficiency in maritime operations.
 Fluent in both written and spoken Business English, with excellent interpersonal, communication, and listening skills for effective interaction across departments and vessels.

What we offer you:
A modern working environment in a central office location (CBD) with a dynamic team spirit. a family-owned shipping company grown with traditions over more than six decades and with different generations of the family members involved in the future growth of the business. a challenging and varied job with a lot of (personal) responsibility. Be part of building structures with a new, motivated & growing team. an attractive salary package with comprehensive Health Insurance

Job Title: Associate Director  Senior Associate Public Affairs
Job Description:
Role
The successful candidate will be part of the Global Public Affairs team, and will support the teams efforts in managing global public policy risks for SHEIN, including implementing strategies / plans to enhance SHEINs credibility and corporate reputation in the following domain areas relevant to the companys business: ESG, tech and data, and trade and investment.

The successful candidate will contribute to the analysis and assessment of key public policies across SHEINs global markets, and the development of recommendations to internal teams on regulatory and operational implications. He/she will also support the development of strategic plans to help SHEIN manage global policy risks and enhance its corporate reputation. In addition, he/she will work closely with relevant teams to develop global strategic partnerships across ESG, tech and data, or trade and investment domain areas, and to communicate key global projects/initiatives to both internal and external stakeholders.

In this role, the candidate must be able to work effectively with various teams, including SHEINs global and market-based Government Relations, Public Relations, Sustainability and business/operational teams.

Responsibilities
Track, monitor and provide assessment of ESG, tech and data, and trade and investment policy issues and their implications to SHEINs business and operations
Support the development of recommendations to senior management and relevant internal teams on strategies to manage public policy risks and enhance SHEINs corporate reputation
Support the development of strategic partnerships with key global stakeholders (e.g. non-governmental and international organisations, industry associations, government officials and regulators, industry and business organisations), for instance public-private partnerships, strategic investment, business development, or social impact projects
Organise and manage meetings with external parties related to ESG, tech and data, and trade and investment issues, including the preparation of briefing notes/presentations for senior managements reference
Support the development of SHEINs annual sustainability and social impact report and other strategic communications materials in support of the companys overall policy positioning and profiling
Qualifications and Experience
Degree in International Relations, Political Science, Global Studies, Law, Economics or related field
At least 5 years of working experience in government relations or public policy relevant to ESG in either the public or private sector
Keen interest in public-private partnerships, strategic investment, business development or social impact projects, with the ability to translate high-level objectives into practical outcomes
Strong analytical, presentation (written and oral) and project management skills
Excellent interpersonal skills
Ability to multi-task and have exceptional attention to detail while operating in a fast-paced and dynamic environment

Job Description:
The National University Health System (NUHS) brings the National University Hospital, and the National University of Singapore's Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine and Faculty of Dentistry under a common governance structure to create synergies to advance its tripartite mission of excellence in clinical care, research and education.

Built to pioneer the next generation of translational clinical research. Designed to offer a new platform of opportunities. The NUHS invites motivated individuals to share their inspirations towards the innovative development of patient services, healthcare and learning environments.

Shape the future of global biomedical healthcare. Challenge yourself to take the lead. Drive a new beginning with NUHS.

Visiting Consultants are appointed in their area of expertises to teach, impart skills in their clinical domain knowledge and to provide consultation, professional advice and clinical services needed by the Department.
Be in active clinical practice;
Possess a basic medical degree from an accredited medical university or medical school;
Postgraduate qualification relevant to the department's specialty or nature of operations; and
Must be registered with the Singapore Medical Council and must be accredited as Specialist by the Specialist Accreditation Board, Ministry of Health

Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Hazardous Waste/Material Disposal Manager shall have a Bachelors degree in Science, Environmental Science, Environmental Health, or Environmental Engineering and have completed a formal 40-hour training course in hazardous waste management.
Hazardous Waste/Material Disposal Manager shall have completed first aid training including cardio pulmonary respiratory (CPR) resuscitation certification.
The Hazardous Waste/Material Disposal Manager shall have intimate knowledge of local and U.S. hazardous waste regulations and hazardous substances transportation requirements, and have certification of Hazardous Waste Operations (HAZWOPER) training and forklift operations.
Shall have a minimum of two years of experience as the Hazardous Waste Coordinator for a Medium Quantity Generator as defined by 40 CFR, or as approved by Government Environmental.
The Manager shall serve as the emergency coordinator in the event of a spill or accident.
Personnel shall have at least five years of work experience performing spill assessment, containment and cleanup of oil or hazardous substance spills in industrial settings.
All spill response personnel, personnel handling, packaging or shipping HW/M shall successfully complete a program of classroom instruction or on-the-job training covering hazardous waste/material management as required by 40 CFR and 29 CFR.
All spill response personnel, personnel performing handling, packaging and shipping of HM/W for transportation shall successfully complete training covering 29 CFR commensurate with their duties. Training certificates shall be maintained and in each persons training folder together with qualification statement and job description. At a minimum, at least one employee shall be authorized to certify outgoing shipments of hazardous cargo material at all times. Training courses are offered by the Naval Supply Corp School in Athens, GA. This school certifies shippers for multi-modal shipments of hazardous material. Contact numbers are: (706) 354-7240, FAX: (706) 354-7280, e-mail address: www.nscs.com.
Hazardous Material (HM) and Hazardous Waste (HW) Personnel Responsible for eTracking or Signing Manifests: All personnel responsible for eTracking or signing manifests for HM or HW shall be certified by attending Hazardous Cargo Certification course IAW NAVSUP 505 and AFR 71-4. Certification is valid for two years, after which re-certification is required. The Contractor shall be responsible for the coordination of certification with NAVSUP FLC Site Singapore no later than 6 months prior to expiration.
Sampling Personnel:
All personnel who perform sampling shall have passed the Environmental Quality Sampling course offered by Naval Civil Engineer Corps Officers School (CECOS), or be approved by KO.
skills: ['Environmental Science', 'HAZWOPER', 'Sampling', 'Classroom', 'Environmental Engineering', 'Hazardous Materials Management', 'Hazardous Waste Management', 'Waste Disposal', 'Environmental Health', 'Hazardous waste', 'Cpr Certified', 'Transportation', 'Packaging', 'First Aid', 'Hazardous Chemicals', 'Shipping', 'Cardio', 'Hazardous Materials']

Job Description:
Job Purpose
Assist the DDI team to provide basic care for patients in inpatient and outpatient settings.
Duties and Responsibilities
2.1 Primary Responsibilities and Duties (80%)
Outpatient setting
Assists in the day to day operation by performing the following duties
Provide instruction for patients to change before procedure
Assist patients in the change room as whenever help is needed
Assist in lifting, moving and transporting patients
Assist patients to procedure room
Attend to patients queries appropriately.
Assist to manage the queue and escalate to supervisor when necessary
Maintain clean and safe environment
Change the linen in the procedure room every morning and ensure sufficient blankets in the rooms.
Monitor usage and disposal of the gowns and replenish daily
Inpatient setting
Assist to call house-keeping for terminal cleaning or disinfection of the room
Give and remove/assist toilet/bedpans and urinals to inpatients
Answer patients call bell and render assistance to patient
Provide good patient care and be attentive to their need
Help to observe changes in patients condition, and escalate as whenever necessarily.
Assist radiographers / nurses in patient transfers in the procedural area.
Prepare patients for imaging/procedures (e.g. risk factor screening, change patients)
Conduct on-the-job training (OJT) for new healthcare assistant (HA).
Keep good record and adhere to Patient Data Protection guidelines
Assist in the inventory stock tracking and monitoring, by topping up the supplies in the ultrasound room and inform the supervisor if the stocks need to be replenished.
2.2 Secondary Responsibilities and Duties (20%)
Maintain general housekeeping of procedure areas.
Perform any other duties as assigned by radiographer in-charge / radiographer on duty supervisor.
Job Specification/Requirements
Preferably GCE N levels and above
Responsible with good interpersonal and communication skills
Have initiative and is a team player

Job Description:
As the Energy & Sustainability Manager for APAC, you will implement the agreed Rolls-Royce energy and sustainability policies, strategy and improvement programmes across the Asia Pacific sites. In this role it is expected that the individual will work closely with the business to deliver energy management and sustainability advice, guidance and energy consumption and cost reduction programmes.

At Rolls-Royce, we look beyond tomorrow. We continually pioneer integrated power and propulsion solutions to deliver cleaner, safer and more competitive power.

Every great product needs a great business behind it. Our work is complex, innovative, highly challenging and rewarding, and it takes a range of professionals to do it. Having the right people means we can deliver excellence to our customers and pioneer the power that matters.

Key Accountabilities:
Develop and build relationships with senior business leaders to understand how energy management and sustainability fits alongside their business drivers and issues
Engage with the businesses and establish site energy/sustainability meetings to set and agree objectives and to monitor progress in the pursuit of energy consumption and greenhouse gas reductions in line with company targets
Assist and support the Head of Energy & Sustainability to implement Rolls-Royce energy and sustainability policies and processes by evaluating their impact and identifying any areas of non-compliance and minimising risk by taking immediate action
Ensure all published SPS energy/sustainability policies and procedures are regularly reviewed, keeping pace with change in key areas, such as legislation, organisational, cultural and technological developments
Assist in communicating energy/sustainability policies to employees and stakeholders, including strategic supplier partners, contractors and visitors
Develop the continuous improvement process with the SPS supply chain, maintaining the development of the partnerships to achieve the optimum solution for all energy ans sustainability related aspects
Undertake research into current best practice, both internally and external to the organisation
Ensure adequate and suitable records and reporting monitors are in place for tracking compliance status, demonstrating a clear audit trail for achieving regulatory compliance and maintaining corporate reputation
Ensure the development and effective implementation of monitors and control systems, monitoring and reporting on energy and utility use, travel and spending trends
Liaising with both internal and external organisations, assisting all sites on energy and sustainability related issues and identifying improvement projects and initiatives
Develop energy and sustainability improvement projects that include formalising scope, obtaining quotes, performing project savings analysis and obtaining project approval
Monitor and maintain regular audits of energy management processes to demonstrate good corporate governance, ensuring completion of audit programmes, which are effective in contributing to improvement, and satisfy regulatory requirements
Manage a number of specialist suppliers / consultants to help deliver the regional energy management and sustainability programme
Qualifications:
Certified Energy Manager by National Environment Agency for Singapore
A proven knowledge in the subject matter area with the ability to articulate and promote the importance and benefits of policies within energy provision and management including an understanding of renewable technology
Energy management, sustainability and/or building services experience within an industrial or property management organisation
Policy and/or Quality Management experience desirable
Experience of dealing at high level within business organisations
Able to contribute to strategic planning
Has Company wide outlook and exposure to different challenges, cultures and ways of working
A degree, post graduate diploma or equivalent in a related subject
Member of a relevant professional body or institute
IT skills including MS Projects, MS Excel and Quality Management Systems
Pioneer an enduring legacy. Join us and youll develop your skills and expertise to the very highest levels, working in an international environment for a company known the world over for brilliance and innovation.

Beyond tomorrow

We are an equal opportunities employer. Were committed to developing a diverse workforce and an inclusive working environment. We believe that people from different backgrounds and cultures give us different perspectives. And the more perspectives we have, the more successful well be. By building a culture of respect and appreciation, we give everyone who works here the opportunity to realize their full potential.
You can learn more about our global Diversity and Inclusion strategy here.

Job Description:
Hegen is a fast-growing company specialising in mother and baby products and with a mission to enhance the breastfeeding journey and help ease the transition into parenthood with meaningful products and services. As one of the top 10 fastest growing companies in Singapore, Hegen takes pride in creating innovative and practical solutions for time-strapped parents.
THE ROLE - Lactation Consultant
Hegen offers passionate and service-spirited Lactation Consultant the opportunity to make a positive difference to parents and babies around the world. With design thinking and service excellence mindset, she will contribute to the growth of this new business unit with meaningful, impactful and rich content that champions breastfeeding and empower parents. We reward those who are committed and passionate in their career to grow with us and build the future together.
Job Description:
Plan, organise and deliver lactation courses to expecting and breastfeeding clients
Review, update and evaluate suitable educational materials to facilitate better content delivery
Provide in-house consultation services to breastfeeding clients
Conduct house visits for the provision of services when required
Attend to clients with breastfeeding queries on social media platforms, walk-in consultations, and other channels
Assist the Marketing and Community team in providing relevant expert tips and responses on social media and ecommerce platforms
Assist the Commercial team in selecting and promoting appropriate breastfeeding related supplies for retail sale and rental
Participate in ideation sessions on new services, products or solutions to help breastfeeding mothers
Create an environment that promotes learning for internal staff, partners and clients
Promote breastfeeding and assist mothers in reaching their own breastfeeding goals
Requirements:
At least 5 years of clinical experience, specifically in the field of lactation
Registered Nurse (RN) with the Singapore Nursing Board
Certified Lactation Counselor
Ability to develop relevant content for workshops and classes on lactation
Relevant teaching experience will be advantageous
IBCLC certification will be advantageous
Willing to travel to clients' residence for consultations
Able to commit working on 2 Saturdays per month

Job Description:
The National University Health System (NUHS) brings the National University Hospital, and the National University of Singapore's Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine and Faculty of Dentistry under a common governance structure to create synergies to advance its tripartite mission of excellence in clinical care, research and education.

Built to pioneer the next generation of translational clinical research. Designed to offer a new platform of opportunities. The NUHS invites motivated individuals to share their inspirations towards the innovative development of patient services, healthcare and learning environments. Shape the future of global biomedical healthcare. Challenge yourself to take the lead. Drive a new beginning with NUHS.

Visiting Consultants are appointed in their area of expertises to teach, impart skills in their clinical domain knowledge and to provide consultation, professional advice and clinical services needed by the Department.
Be in active clinical practice;
Possess a basic medical degree from an accredited medical university or medical school;
Postgraduate qualification relevant to the department's specialty or nature of operations; and
Must be registered with the Singapore Medical Council and must be accredited as Specialist by the Specialist Accreditation Board, Ministry of Health.

Job Description:
The National University Health System (NUHS) is an integrated Academic Health System and Regional Health System in Singapore that delivers value-driven, innovative and sustainable healthcare. Institutions in the NUHS group include three hospitals  National University Hospital, Ng Teng Fong General Hospital and Jurong Community Hospital; three National Specialty Centres  National University Cancer Institute, Singapore, National University Heart Centre, Singapore and National University Centre for Oral Health, Singapore; a polyclinic group  the National University Polyclinics; one medical centre  Jurong Medical Centre; and three academic health sciences institutions  National University of Singapore (NUS) Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine (including the Alice Lee Centre for Nursing Studies), NUS Faculty of Dentistry and NUS Saw Swee Hock School of Public Health.

The Departments are seeking candidates who are highly motivated and willing to join us for a challenging and fulfilling appointment as Associate Consultant on a contractual basis.

As an Associate Consultant, you will be required to carry out the duties as directed by the Head of Department in accordance with the policies and guidelines set by the Hospital, National University Hospital (NUH) and the Ministry of Health (MOH).
You must be able to demonstrate good technical skills (i.e. operative and procedural skills where applicable).
Possess a basic medical degree and a postgraduate qualifications relevant to the departments specialty or nature of operations registrable with the Singapore Medical Council
Be in active clinical practice
Must be registered with the Singapore Medical Council and must be accredited as Specialists by the Specialist Accreditation Board, Ministry of Health
Able to work independently with demonstrated competence in managing patients in the department
Confident, takes initiatives and a good team player

Job Description:
Job Summary:

We are seeking an experienced and skilled Team Leader to lead and manage a team of General Practitioners support staff. The successful candidate will be responsible for guiding and directing the team to achieve clinical excellence, quality patient care, and business objectives.

Key Responsibilities:

- Lead and manage a team of support staff, providing guidance, support, and coaching to ensure individual and team success
- Develop and implement clinical and business strategies to achieve team goals and objectives
- Monitor and evaluate team performance, identifying areas for improvement and implementing corrective actions
- Foster a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning among team members
- Develop and maintain relationships with key stakeholders, including patients, staff, and external partners
- Ensure compliance with clinical governance, regulatory requirements, and company policies
- Identify opportunities for growth and development, and implement initiatives to enhance patient care and business performance

Requirements:

- 3 years of experience in a leadership or supervisory role
- Strong clinical knowledge and expertise in general practice
- Excellent communication, coaching, and interpersonal skills
- Ability to lead and manage change, with a focus on innovation and improvement
- Strong business acumen and understanding of healthcare operations

Job Description:
Our client is actively searching for a Data Analyst/ Senior Data Analyst to join their team!
If you are a dynamic individual seeking a new career opportunity, read further!

As a Data Analyst/Engineer, you will be responsible for creating user-friendly applications that will be able to launch Machine Learning (ML) models and trigger automation solutions. You will need to work closely with cross-functional team of data scientists, engineers, business stakeholders and IT team to support patient care and improve health services delivery.

The responsibilities of this role are:
Lead in the gathering of requirements by working and coordinating with clinicians and business stakeholders.
Translate business requirements into system and architecture design of applications.
Work with cross-functional teams to successfully develop and deploy automation solutions (including ML Model), ensuring timelines and quality standards are met.
Work with the IT/data management team to design, architect and maintain the required data inflow and outflow.
Liaise with analytics platform and clinical system custodians for model deployment and workflow integration.
Communicate effectively with stakeholders about progress, challenges, and outcomes, translating complex technical concepts into understandable terms.
Drive continuous improvement model performance and facilitating adoption.
Create and maintain proper project documentations.
Perform de-identification and encryption for department managed datasets according to data management guideline.
Take accountability in considering compliance to policies, guidelines and regulations and take appropriate steps to mitigate the risks.
Provide prompt feedback to supervisor in anticipation of work-related problems.
Perform general administrative duties as required.
Carry out any other duties or responsibilities assigned by the Supervisor and/or the Head of Department.
The ideal candidate will need to have the following qualities and experience:
Minimum Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Software Engineering or equivalent with at least two (2) years of experience.
Proficient in programming languages such as Python (e.g., Flask, Django), R (e.g., Shiny), SQL.
Experience in managing AI/ML products is highly desirable.
Experience in SharePoint, Excel (Visual Basic), HTML, XML, Java preferred.
Knowledge in Data anonymization, de-identification and re-identification process and techniques is preferred.
Possess skills in statistical modeling and machine learning with experience in data storage, processing, analytics and distribution software and platforms.
Strong communication/people skills required to interact with data scientists, engineers, business end-users and vendors to design and develop solutions.
Ability to write clear documentation of procedures, and ability to write specifications for data models to be developed.
Participate actively as a team member in organizational development and quality improvement.
Be a change agent and inculcate mindset for change for hospital-wide and departmental- level.
Able to work beyond routine work responsibilities and office hours, in the exigencies of services e.g., during infectious disease outbreaks.
An exciting career awaits the right candidate! Click "Quick Apply" to register your interest now.

All applicants' CV will be treated with the strictest confidentiality. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Job Description:
Join Our Passionate Team at WINGS Therapy and Learning Center!
Are you ready to make a real impact in the lives of children, teens, and young adults? WINGS Therapy and Learning Center, Singapores first intensive therapy center, is searching for a motivated and enthusiastic Occupational Therapy Assistant to become part of our dynamic, vibrant, and innovative team!
At WINGS, we are transforming lives with ground-breaking therapiesthe first of their kind in Singapore.
We are looking for dedicated professionals who share our commitment to restoring motion, mobility, and independence for individuals with diverse abilities and conditions.
Why Join WINGS?
Be part of a collaborative, forward-thinking team that is passionate about creating meaningful change.
Gain exposure to innovative, world-class therapy approaches that push boundaries and inspire results.
Work with a diverse patient base, with a strong focus on paediatrics, sensory processing challenges, and developmental conditions.
Enjoy a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and ongoing professional development.
The Role: Occupational Therapist Assistant
This role is perfect for someone with a genuine passion for helping individuals overcome challenges and achieve their full potential.
Key Responsibilities:
Provide individualized assessments and therapies to children, teenagers, and young adults with learning and developmental challenges.
Deliver therapy to children with sensory processing difficulties, working to enhance their daily lives.
Collaborate with parents to create tailored strategies that support each childs learning and growth at home.
Work closely with a multidisciplinary team to provide holistic care that meets every childs unique needs.
About You:
Were seeking individuals with the following:
Experience: At least 12 years of practice as an Occupational Therapist.
Qualifications: A recognized degree/qualification in Occupational Therapy.
Skills & Passion: Comfortable working with children with autism, neuromuscular disorders, or developmental delays. You are passionate, approachable, organized, and a great team player.
What Youll Receive:
Client-focused approach with a heartwarming, ethical work environment.
Training in some of the worlds most transformative therapy techniques.
The chance to work with a diverse range of patients and make a lasting difference.
A competitive remuneration package that rewards your dedication and talent.
If youre ready to take your career to the next level while making a meaningful impact, wed love to hear from you! Please send your resume to hr@wingstherapycenter.com.
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
Join us in shaping brighter futuresone step, one movement, and one milestone at a time!
ABOUT WINGS THERAPY AND LEARNING CENTER (WINGS)
Founded in 2017, WINGS is Singapores first intensive therapy centre to offer transformative therapies such as Pediatric Physical Therapy, Occupational Therapy, Early Intervention, Suit Therapy (NeuroSuit and TheraSuit Method), Spider Cage Therapy, Universal Exercise Unit, Dynamic Movement Intervention (DMI), Intensive Gait Training with LiteGait, Robotic Gait Training with Trexo Robotics, Task Specific Electrical Stimulation (TASES), Vibration Therapy with Galileo, Autism Fitness and Sports for The Special Child. WINGS also provides seating assessments, equipment consultations and dynamic orthotic solutions such TheraTogs and Dynamic Movement Orthoses.
Since its inception, over 6000 babies, children, teenagers, and young adults have walked through our doors and found new options. At WINGS, our dedicated and highly trained therapists provide intensive programmes to help children and young adults with a broad range of conditions.
These include, but are not limited to: Cerebral Palsy, Developmental Delay. Traumatic and Anoxic Brain Injuries, Spina Bifida, Ataxia, Dystonia/Athetosis, Hypertonicity, Hypotonicity, Post-Stroke, Down Syndrome, Genetic Disorders, Metabolic Disorders, Prematurity, Torticollis/Wry Neck (head tilt), Muscular Dystrophy, Delays in Developmental Milestones, Hypotonia (weakness, low tone), Hypertonia (tightness, high tone), Gross Motor Incoordination, Motor Planning Difficulties, Gait Difficulties, Orthotic Concerns and Neurological Problems.
For more information, please visit:
www.wingstherapycenter.com
@WingsTherapyCenter
@wings_therapy

Job Description:
We are a step-down nursing home, caring for female residents who are mentally and emotionally challenged.

We are located at:
Buangkok Green Medical Centre
10, Buangkok View
Block 5, Level 5 & 6
Singapore 539747

We are currently looking for candidates under the CCP for Social Workers.

Job Description
 Co-ordinates social services through a case management approach.
 Addresses psychosocial needs through care and counselling.
 Assists staff members in understanding the significant social and emotional factors related to the resident's health problems. Liaises with internal colleagues on matters / feedback relating to residents, fellow colleagues
 Participates in the development of the plan of care. Attends multi-disciplinary meetings with medical staff, nurses, other healthcare professional and non-professionalsto discuss, propose and coordinate care plans for residents.
 Works with other health professionals significantly involved in the care of the resident.
 Discusses long-term care issues with the resident and family.
 As an case admission coordinator - liaises and works with all referral sources; plan and coordinate case admission
 Screens the social background of all new applicants and applies means test to determine chargeable fees;
 Advises residents and family members on chargeable fees and refers them for subsidies, financial aid if necessary.

 Prepares social and other related reports for file, management and other related institutions / agencies
