Job Description:
Abbott is a global healthcare leader, creating breakthrough science to improve peoples health. Were always looking towards the future, anticipating changes in medical science and technology.

Primary Function:
Provide leadership in the operations of the Process Research Lab (PRL) and Asia Pilot Plant (APP).
Support/Lead change control activities, quality impact assessment, investigation, CAPA, and audits for pilot plant operations.
Implement continuous improvements to enhance efficiency and participate in related cross-functional projects.
Major Responsibilities:
Accountable for the safety, quality and regulatory compliance of the entire shift operations.
Ensure timely manufacture of research prototypes that meet the intended research purposes.
Lead and supervise shift technicians and in-house contract technicians in the operation of multiple process equipment systems.
Perform routine operations tasks. Monitor and maintain process equipment in compliance with site safety procedures and current good manufacturing practices (cGMP) within the Asia Pilot Plant (APP) and Process Research Lab (PRL).
Coordinate/support trial material readiness.
Coordinate ad-hoc maintenance activities. Coordination may include oversight of third-party contractors and vendors.
Support/lead risk assessment and development of standard operating procedures related to operations and maintenance of process equipment systems.
Support/lead safety and quality events investigation, identify and implement corrective and preventive actions (CAPA).
Support/lead and execute equipment qualification (ES/IQ/OQ/PQ).
Complete review of trial records on time.
Complete internal and external training assessments on time.
Provide honest, accurate feedback to peers and superiors and exchange relevant information openly.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to optimize processes and enhance productivity.
Perform other related duties as assigned by supervisor
Requirements:
Diploma/Bachelors degree in Mechanical, Chemical Process Technology, Food Technology or related disciplines
Minimum 3 years of relevant experience in production/manufacturing, preferably in GMP environment
Well-versed with Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills.
Good leadership, organizational and communication skills.
Good team player with initiative.
Ability to multitask, prioritize tasks and stay focused effectively.
Ability to draft technical protocols with minimum supervision.
Must be able to do shift work (rotating day/night shift) and willing to do overtime if required for urgent situations.
*Kindly note this position is based in Tuas and requires 12 hour rotation shift pattern.

Job Description:
We are seeking an experienced Research Fellow specialized in intellectual property (IP) development and patents within the wastewater treatment sector. This role is integral to our mission of innovating and commercializing eco-friendly, cost-effective wastewater solutions using cutting-edge electrochemistry technology.

What you will be doing
Innovation and Research: Lead exploratory research projects to innovate and enhance our technology, focusing on areas ripe for intellectual property creation.
Intellectual Property Management: Develop strategies for IP protection, including drafting, filing, and prosecuting patents, and managing the company's IP portfolio.
Collaboration and Leadership: Work closely with R&D and product development teams to identify patentable inventions, ensure IP protection strategies align with product development, and advise on potential IP challenges.
Technology Analysis: Conduct comprehensive analysis of existing technologies and market trends to identify opportunities for IP development and potential patent infringements to avoid.
Legal Coordination: Liaise with legal advisors and patent offices to navigate the patent landscape, ensuring compliance with international IP laws and regulations.
Publication and Advocacy: Publish research findings in reputable scientific journals and represent Hydroleap at conferences, contributing to the companys reputation as a leader in the field.
Educational Outreach: Mentor junior researchers and engineers on IP matters, fostering an environment of continuous learning and innovation.
Your Capabilities and Credentials
MSc or PhD in Chemical or Environmental engineering
Demonstrated experience in research with a significant track record of intellectual property development, including patent drafting and filing.
Familiar and interested in water/wastewater treatment processes
Familiar with water treatment processes and lab equipments
Familiar and interested in scientific paper reading, research and lab work
Strong analytical, strategic thinking, and communication skills, with proficiency in research methodologies and patent databases.
Commitment to the task assigned, self initiative and problem solving skill

Job Description:
Hydroleap is a Singapore-grown water treatment startup backed by governmental and private VCs. Seek to displace chemical pretreatment processes with proprietary, IoT-enabled electrical treatment technology. Hydroleap's deep technical expertise allows us to design modular electrical treatment processes and deliver end-to-end wastewater treatment systems, offering solutions that are automated, robust, cost-effective, and environmentally friendly.
Backed by reputable governmental and private venture capitalists (VCs) such as Wavemaker, Enterprise Singapore (Seeds Capital & SGInnovate), 500 Startups, Sparklabs Cultiv8, Entrepreneur First and a few more.

Your Key Responsibilities

The role of the Research Assistant is consisting of carrying out research programs while observing the objectives defined by the business division. To support R&D activities in wastewater treatment, and environmental control system.

Your Key Responsibilities
Engaging R&D and product development activities to enable new product introduction and improvements.
Design product and system prototypes to receive feedback and identify areas of improvement through R&D studies.
Assisting the operation team to identify and troubleshoot the technical problems associated with the products.
Involving mainly in R&D department and working closely with the rest of the technical, business, production, and operation teams for designing, manufacturing and implementation of innovative water and wastewater solutions.
Evaluate alternatives, resolve technical issues and interface with other disciplines.
Ensure technical accuracy, standard engineering practices and inclusion of appropriate documentation on various report and design project.
Collection and sampling of water sample at client's site
Ensure good housekeeping in the laboratory and pilot plant and be responsible for the safety and environment compliance of the new processes.
Perform other duties as needed.
Qualifications

Education and Experience
Diploma in Chemistry or Environmental Studies
Preferable with internship experience in water treatment-based industry.
Strong communication, skilled in report and technical writing, organization, analytical and interpersonal skills.
Self-starter with ability work together with team members.
Have enthusiasm for R&D work and field work

Job Description:
Chugai Pharmabody Research Pte. Ltd. (CPR) was established in Singapore as a wholly-owned subsidiary of Chugai Pharmaceutical Co., Ltd (Chugai), a member of Roche group, in January 2012 and started operations on July 2, 2012. Located at Biopolis in Singapore, it aims to generate new antibody drugs based on Chugais proprietary antibody engineering technologies, such as recycling antibody, sweeping antibody, bispecific antibody, various Fc engineered antibodies, and other new antibody engineering technologies that are under development.

Position  Senior Scientist in Lead Optimization Unit
CPR is seeking for a scientist with expertise in protein engineering.

Job requirements
The applicant should be highly skilled in at least one of the following areas:
Strong and proven expertise in structural biology and molecular biology for protein structure/function investigation.
Advance knowledge in protein and/or antibody engineering, including but not limited to rational or random mutagenesis engineering approach.
Expertise in protein biochemistry, protein expression, purification, and characterization.
Strong organizational skills to deal with large amounts of data and excellent communication and collaborative skills, as well as a team player mindset for working with cross-functional multi-disciplinary teams.
Knowledge and skill of high-throughput system, automation, and/or general scripting language is a plus but not a must.
Knowledge and skill of cell biology, biophysics or immunology is a plus but not a must.
The applicant must have completed and be awarded with a relevant Ph.D. degree in Biomedical Science/Biochemistry/Chemical Biology/Biotechnology/Information science with 1-2 years of working experience in a related field. In addition, the successful candidates must be able to demonstrate technical expertise in areas which may include molecular biology, cell biology, protein chemistry and protein engineering as evidenced by projects, presentations, or peer-reviewed scientific publications.

As frequent communication and liaison is expected between both the Singapore and Japan office, you should possess an excellent command of both spoken and written Japanese and English languages.

For more information regarding our Company, you may refer to our website at: http://chugai-pharmabody.com/

We regret that only short-listed candidates will be notified

Job Title: Youth Work Associate Woodlands Part Time
Job Description:
Core Responsibilities
1) Specialised Support and Connection with HNS
Provide tailored support and guidance across various HNS programmes to foster meaningful connections.
Cultivate an inclusive and supportive atmosphere conducive to growth and engagement.

2) Monitoring and Reporting
Maintain comprehensive records, sharing insights on HNS development with the Core Team and Form Teachers.
Track individual student by providing interpretive anecdotes and assessments of HNS progress, attendance, personal experiences such as challenges, and achievements during the programmes.

3) Supporting HNS through Project F.L.Y@Innova Acheivers Programme
Plan, implement and review after school activities in various domains (e.g. Art, Music, Sports etc) to meaningfully engage HNS focusing on building resilience, self-esteem & self-efficacy, developing SEL competencies and strengthening peer support.
Provide one-on-one and group support to HNS during the F.L.Y Achievers programme, fostering an environment that nurtures growth and fosters inclusivity.
3) Supporting HNS through Project L.O.L@Innova Leaders Programme
Plan, implement and review a group mentoring after school programme to engage HNS focusing on building self-worth, mindfulness, resilience and compassion.
Provide tailored experiential learning, cultivating communication skills, diverse perspectives, and mutual support.

4) Supporting students through Project F.L.Y@Pathfinder Programme
Plan, implement and review a termly relationship-building and team-building programme for the P3 and P5 students and their Form Teachers at the start/end of each term.
Design and implement a level-wide conflict resolution programme for one level of students.

5) Supporting HNS through Homework Support Club
Foster a conducive environment within the Homework Club to aid HNS in completing their homework effectively.
Offer personalised assistance to HNS, aiding in structuring their homework schedule, monitoring learning advancements, and cultivating positive study habits and attitudes while providing academic support whenever possible.
Facilitate relationship-building through individual or small-group activities when homework tasks are progressing satisfactorily.
6) Conducting Staff Workshops
Support staff development by conducting appropriate staff training workshops that will aid in the support of HNS.

Job Description:
About STT GDC

Be part of a global leader in data centre solutions
ST Telemedia Global Data Centres (STT GDC) is a data centre provider headquartered in Singapore, with a global footprint in major business markets across Singapore, the United Kingdom, Germany, India, Thailand, South Korea, Indonesia, Japan, the Philippines, Malaysia and Vietnam. We harness cutting-edge technology to deliver a comprehensive suite of world-class, scalable and flexible data centre solutions, including connectivity and support services, designed to meet the evolving colocation needs of today and tomorrow. By joining our team, youll be part of a dynamic, fast-growing industry that forms the cornerstone of todays digital world.

Why STT GDC
STT GDCs internal culture is built on creating a forward-thinking, socially responsible environment that ignites positive change. We empower our employees to thrive in a workplace defined by excellence, innovation and growth, where collaboration and creativity can flourish.

 Empathy-driven culture: We lead with compassion and understanding, fostering a supportive and inclusive environment that values your well-being and voice.
 Collaborative and vibrant workplace: We celebrate diversity and the power of teamwork. We value every idea and strive for constant improvement through collective innovation
 Opportunities for growth: At STT GDC, we dont just offer roles  we cultivate long-term career pathways. Through professional development programs, mentorships and stretch assignments, we are committed to enabling you to grow and reach your full potential.

Key Duties and Responsibilities

As the Assistant Manager, EHS, you will be representing STT GDC in managing and overseeing all EHS related matters for construction, addition and alteration (A&A) and customer fit-out projects to ensure all legal and STT GDC Group EHS requirements are fulfilled. Additionally, you will also support country EHS manager in the management of operational EHS at the data centres.
Manage and maintain full oversight of construction, A&A and customer fit-out projects to ensure STT GDCs Group Minimum Standards (GMS) and any other related STT GDC EHS standards and requirements, relevant statutory obligations and regulatory requirements, codes, and laws, are implemented, efficiently managed, and maintained throughout the duration of each project.
Work in conjunction with the Contractor site management team to ensure the Project Safety Management System is implemented for construction and A&A projects.
Conduct 6-monthly compliance audits for construction and A&A projects, prepare audit report and follow up on the findings with relevant stakeholders till closure.
Attend daily Construction / A&A Project Coordination meetings led by Contractor Project Manager to ensure all safety matters are addressed for the activities scheduled.
Collect and prepare monthly safety report for construction and A&A projects including required EHS metrics for data consolidation, e.g., man-hours worked, leading & lagging indicators, safety compliance status any other required information, etc.
Work closely with and provide support to the Singapore Data Centre Operations Project Team and General Contractor in ensuring work activities are adequately planned and executed safely and in full compliance to applicable legal and STT GDC EHS requirements.
Review and provide constructive input on projects as well as operational data centre related high-risk work processes and their relevant safety documents (e.g. risks assessments, safe work procedures, worker competencies, equipment licenses, etc); including the oversight of high-risk work execution (May occur on weekends / after office hours).
Oversee all safety incidents or near misses that occur for projects and operational data centres to ensure they are duly reported and investigated in conformance with STT GDC Incident Management standards.
Review injury/incident reports and investigations for completeness. In cases where dangerous occurrences or incidents with major injuries have occurred, to assist with onsite investigations within short notice.
Perform regular EHS assurance walkdowns, task observations and inspections for project and operational data centre related activities; prepare findings report and follow up on actions till closure.
Attend all essential project and operational data centre related EHS meetings / reviews and prepare meeting minutes as directed by the Country EHS Manager.
Assist the Country EHS Manager in ISO45001 / BizSafe audits and certifications.
Plan, develop and execute EHS programs, procedures and awareness activities for the Singapore data centres.
Support any other EHS activities, initiatives and tasks as assigned by the Country EHS Manager for both projects and operational data centres.
Requirements
Bachelors Degree/ Tertiary Level Qualification in Engineering or related fields.
Minimum 8 years of EHS management experience in Construction / Addition & Alteration type of works (post WSHO registration), with at least 2 years of experience in managing EHS in operations.
Data centre, facility management or manufacturing related EHS experience is an added advantage.Must be a registered Workplace Safety and Health Officer (WSHO) with the Ministry of Manpower (MOM).
Registered Environmental Control Officer (ECO) with the National Environment Agency (NEA), is preferred.
Excellent communication and people skills.
Good problem solving and analytical skills.
Strong EHS technical knowledge and proficient in Microsoft Office.

Develop and Implement Safety Policies: Create comprehensive safety policies in compliance with local laws, company safety standards, and customer requirements.
Risk Assessment: Develop and review risk assessments to identify workplace hazards, ensuring all equipment, workspaces, and practices meet safety standards.
Safety Training: Organize and conduct safety training, including site safety orientations, to align with local regulations and company policies.
Accident Investigation & Reporting: Investigate workplace incidents to determine root causes, maintain accurate records, and report findings to relevant authorities.
Emergency Preparedness: Develop and implement emergency procedures, such as fire drills and evacuation plans, ensuring all employees are trained and emergency equipment is functional.
Health Programs: Promote workplace health initiatives, such as ergonomic assessments and wellness programs, to prevent occupational diseases.
Liaise with External Parties: Collaborate with regulatory authorities, auditors, and external consultants on compliance matters, inspections, and safety improvements.
Compliance Monitoring: Stay updated on health and safety legislation in Singapore, ensuring organizational compliance and advising management on necessary policy updates.
Requirements:
Min 3 years of relevant experience in a manufacturing setting.
Strong knowledge of local safety regulations and standards.
Excellent risk assessment, incident investigation, and reporting skills.
With Certification in Workplace Safety and Health (WSH) or related qualifications.
Singaporean only.

Job Description:
Benefits
Attractive Salary: Basic salary up to $5,000 + Variable Bonus + AWS.
Working Hours: 44-hour work week (Monday to Friday: 9am-6pm, Saturday: 9am-1pm).
Convenient Transportation: Grab Pool services provided for travel to the worksite and nearest MRT station (Punggol).
Growth-Oriented Role: Opportunity to lead safety protocols and maintain compliance with WSH regulations.
Performance-Based Rewards: Bonuses tied to both individual and company performance.
Job Summary
As the Safety Officer for the main contractor, you will report to the Project Manager and oversee safety protocols at the construction site. This includes conducting inspections, implementing safety measures, facilitating training, and ensuring compliance with Singapores Workplace Safety and Health (WSH) regulations.
Key Responsibilities
Site Inspections: Conduct regular safety inspections and audits to ensure compliance with WSH regulations.
Risk Management: Perform risk assessments and implement control measures to mitigate hazards.
Training and Education: Organize safety training programs, toolbox meetings, and emergency response drills.
Incident Management: Investigate accidents and near-misses, recommend preventive measures, and prepare reports.
Safety Protocols: Implement and enforce safety procedures, liaising with MOM and other regulatory bodies.
Emergency Preparedness: Develop emergency response plans and conduct regular site readiness drills.
Documentation and Reporting: Maintain records of inspections, training sessions, incidents, and monthly safety performance reports.
Communication: Act as the safety liaison between management and workers, fostering a culture of safety.
Qualifications
Diploma or degree in Occupational Safety and Health, Environmental Science, or a related field.
Valid WSHO (Workplace Safety and Health Officer) certification recognized by MOM.
3-5 years of experience as a Safety Officer in the construction industry.
Strong understanding of WSH regulations and site safety practices in Singapore.
Proficient in report writing, record-keeping, and risk assessment.
Excellent communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
Work outdoors in varying weather conditions.
Additional Information
Location: 2 Seletar North Link, PPT Lodge 1B, #02-01, Singapore 797601..
Work Arrangements:Days: Monday to Friday (9am-6pm), Saturday (9am-1pm).
Transport: Grab Pool services provided.
Overtime: Compensated with time off in lieu.
Medical Coverage: Comprehensive coverage for workplace health and safety.HSE Officer (Health, Safety, and Environment)

Job Title: Head Of Corporate Affairs Ropu Askan
Job Description:
The Position
Acts as the custodian of Boehringer Ingelheim's brand and reputation and ensures excellence in both internal and external communications. Guides and advises senior leaders in the handling of communications at times of crisis. Plays a key role in facilitating employee engagement through positive internal communications.
To lead the Corporate Affairs functions in ROPU ASKAN.
To develop, protect and promote Boehringer Ingelheim's corporate profile, brand and reputation with internal and external stakeholders and experts to ensure they are fully informed about the businesses, its activities, products and services, and see Boehringer as a partner of choice.
The Head of Corporate Affairs ROPU ASKAN is an active member of the Divisions Extended Corporate Affairs Leadership Team and together with their corporate and R/OPU counterparts plays an active role in developing campaigns, aligning on strategic topics and priorities to secure tactical and operational alignment across Corporate Affairs globally.
The Head of Corporate Affairs ROPU ASKAN is also an active member of the ROPU Executive Committee (ExCom).
Duties & Responsibilities
Develops and executes an effective internal communications strategy aligned with our Global Priorities and Communications agenda to ensure everyone in ROPU ASKAN is actively and positively engaged with the organizations strategy and objectives, plans and activities, and understands the Boehringer values and behaviors and their application.
Develops and executes an effective and impactful public and government affairs strategy to shape the necessary policy environment so that it is favorable to Boehringer Ingelheim, engaging a broad range of public policy stakeholders such as politicians, industry associations and policy makers.Develops evidence that matters for government decision-making, establishing long-term relationships with policy and decision makers, positioning Boehringer Ingelheim as a partner of choice.
Acts as a critical link, internally connecting with Boehringer Ingelheim, including e.g. Human Pharma Healthcare Affairs and Patient Engagement, and externally connecting Boehringer Ingelheim with policy makers needs and expectations.
Monitors the political and policy environment, ensuring senior management is fully informed of key developments with a significant business impact.
Promotes and protects Boehringer Ingelheims corporate profile, brand and reputation based on our Global Priorities, and our global Communications and Public and Government Affairs agendas, so that we help foster unique collaborations and partnerships, attract and retain future employees, and build trust with stakeholders in our products, our science and our brand. This includes overseeing the corporate social media channels and advising the business on social media techniques and tactics.
Defines and executes fully integrated, strategic, campaign-driven and impactful communications, maximizing (product) awareness and managing the brand and reputation of Boehringer Ingelheim to support profitable growth of the portfolio across the Animal Health and Human Pharma businesses.
Develops and manages plans for handling communications at times of crisis; advises senior management on all aspects of communications at such times; creates and delivers any necessary communications and engagement plans following a crisisRisks to reputation are minimized, stakeholders are managed appropriately, and the organization is restored to "business as usual" as quickly as possible.
Drives the ROPU ASKANs Sustainable Development for Generations (SD4G) and local community engagement communications.
Leads the Corporate Affairs team ensuring high performance and motivation by providing coaching, training, regular constructive feedback on performance and opportunities for development.
Acts as a sparring partner and advisor to the CMD and relevant ExCom colleagues as they engage internally and externally with stakeholders.

Requirements
Masters / Bachelor's Degree in Communications, Journalism, or related field, with at least 10  15 years of relevant work experience in Corporate Affairs. Experience in Pharmaceutical / Life Sciences industry a plus
An experienced and highly motivated leader in developing communications and public & government affairs at both a strategic and operational level for the region.
Excellent verbal and written command in English, strong on media work and influencing strategies to act as the Company expert on all aspects of communications and public & government affairs; internal, external, utilization of appropriate media, ensuring activities are compliant with local regulations and guidelines.
Possess detailed knowledge of the regions political systems and processes and local industry association landscape, to develop a good understanding of Boehringer Ingelheims ROPU ASKAN business, activities, products and services.
Ability to work under pressure and deliver to agreed deadlines, coordinates, and manages multiple priorities from a broad range of internal stakeholders whilst balancing the requirement to also manage external stakeholders, responding to unforeseen circumstances.
Confident public speaker, able to engage a room of individuals with different perspectives and position a potentially controversial debate.
Independent & comfortable speaking up; pro-active, precise and hands-on attitude, communicates clearly and effectively
skills: ['Pharmaceutical Industry', 'Leadership', 'Public Policy', 'Public Affairs', 'Government Affairs', 'Strategic Thinking', 'Employee Engagement', 'Internal & External Communications', 'Communication Skills', 'Regional experience', 'Stakeholder Engagement and Management']

Job Description:
The primary focus of this position is the support the maintenance of the human resource management system (HRMS) in addition to other systems supported by the HRIS team. This position serves as a technical point of contact for assigned functional areas and assists subject matter experts with ensuring data integrity, testing of system changes, report writing and analyzing data flows for process improvement opportunities. The HRIS analyst also supports HRMS upgrades, patches, testing and other technical projects as assigned.

Essential Functions
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
System Maintenance (5% of time): Assist in the review, testing and implementation of HRMS upgrades or patches. Collaborate with functional and technical staff to coordinate application of upgrade or fix. Maintain HRMS tables. Document process and results.
Production Support (20% of time): Provide support for HRMS, including researching and resolving HRMS problems, unexpected results or process flaws; performing scheduled activities; recommending solutions or alternate methods to meet requirements.
Projects/Process Improvement (55% of time): Recommend process/customer service improvements, innovative solutions, policy changes and/or major variations from established policy that must be approved by appropriate leadership prior to implementation. Serve as a key liaison with third parties and other stakeholders (e.g. payroll). Use project management skills in managing projects. May provide overall project management for a given HR initiative.
Reports/Queries (10% of time): Write, maintain and support a variety of reports or queries using appropriate reporting tools. Assist in development of standard reports for ongoing customer needs. Help maintain data integrity in systems by running queries and analyzing data.
Training (5% of time): Develop user procedures, guidelines and documentation. Train clients on new processes/functionality. Train new system users.
Individual Development (5% of time): Maintain awareness of current trends in HRMS with a focus on product and service development, delivery and support, and applying key technologies. Examine trends in information systems training, materials and techniques. Through classes, reading, CBTs or other mechanisms, continuously increase both HR knowledge and HRIS application/tools knowledge. Participate in user group meetings/conferences.
Requirements
Min Degree in Human Resources
Min 4-5 years of experience would be at an advantage
Office Hours/ 5 Days
Excellent communication skills is a must
Good management skills of team

Job Description:
Job Description:
We are seeking a talented and motivated Automation Engineer (Robotics / Process) to join our team. As an Automation Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, implementing, and maintaining automation solutions to streamline our processes, improve efficiency, and enhance product quality. You will work in a dynamic environment that encourages innovation and continuous improvement.
Responsibilities:
Automation Framework Development
Design, develop, and maintain automation frameworks for software and hardware testing, process automation, and data integration.
Collaboration
Work with cross-functional teams to understand automation requirements and deliver solutions that meet business needs.
Documentation
Write and maintain efficient, reusable documentation for automated tasks and prepare test cases.
Efficiency Improvement
Identify areas where automation can improve operational efficiency and minimize manual intervention.
System Maintenance
Maintain and troubleshoot existing automation systems, applying necessary updates and enhancements.
Industry Awareness
Stay informed about industry trends and emerging technologies to recommend and implement improvements.
Technical Support
Provide training and technical support to team members on automation tools and best practices.
Process Documentation
Record automation processes, test cases, and results for reference and audit purposes.
Project Coordination
Coordinate meetings with business stakeholders to ensure timely delivery of automation solutions.
Key Attributes:
Consulting Skills: Ability to analyze business requirements, propose realistic solutions, and ensure project control in alignment with business needs.
Problem Solving: Analyze, implement, and support solutions until deliverables meet expectations.
Support Role: Handle tickets and assist in the support process.
Requirement Gathering: Collaborate with clients to define and gather business requirements.
Qualifications:
Experience: 47 years of relevant work experience in automation engineering, with a focus on robotics and process automation.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in Linux, VBA, and relevant programming languages.
Development Practices: Experience with CI/CD (Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment) practices.
Analytical Ability: Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Soft Skills: Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
Adaptability: Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, agile development environment.
Certifications (Preferred): Certification in automation or related fields.
Industry Experience (Preferred): Experience in logistics or manufacturing.

Job Title: Aesthetics Doctor  Perceptorship & Bond Transfer Scheme Provided
Job Description:
Job Overview
Competitive Remuneration: Monthly salary package ranges between $25,000 to $35,000.
Working Schedule: up to 5 work day per week
Training: Comprehensive and structured preceptorship training led by senior doctors and our Medical Director with extensive experience in aesthetic dermatology.
Opportunity Overview:
Join Our Team and Shape the Future of the Medical-Aesthetics Industry! ClearSK manages the award-winning ClearSK chain of medi-aesthetic centres with presence in Singapore, Shanghai, Hangzhou and Kuala Lumpur. As a Singapore leading aesthetics and healthcare chain, it will be a great opportunity for you to grow and learn in a multi-disciplinary environment with medical and management professionals. You will find yourself working in a challenging environment, where your capabilities will be developed to the maximum potential. To fit in with our culture of excellence, we look for only the F.I.T.: Fast, Innovative and Trainable as well as commitment, integrity and professional skills.
Reasons to Join Us:
Receive structured training under the guidance of our senior doctors and Medical Director who has 20 years of aesthetic dermatology medical experience, designed to equip you with the essential skills for aesthetic procedures. No prior experience in aesthetics is required.
Junior doctors currently under MOHH are welcome, offering flexibility in terms of career progression. For those who excel in an aesthetics-focused practice, further details on our MOH bond transfer scheme will be discussed during the interview process.
Very Competitive remuneration packages are available, monthly salary ranging from $25,000 to $35,000.
Up to 5-day work week only.
We are one of the earliest established medical aesthetic group in Singapore with clinics all around Singapore.
ClearSK is committed to the ongoing professional development of its staff, offering sponsorship for relevant aesthetic courses and conferences.
Overseas assignment opportunities for strong performers.
Responsibilities:
Report to the Director of Operations and Medical Director.
Conduct professional skin & body consultations, tailoring treatment plans based on individual needs.
Collaborate with healthcare professionals to optimize treatment outcomes.
Administer medical-grade aesthetic treatments.
Record patient feedback and adapt treatment plans for improved clinical results.
Collaborate with management and clinic staff to achieve organizational goals.
Contribute to research & development, including developing new treatment programs and training materials.
Requirements:
Full registration with the Singapore Medical Council.
A tertiary degree in medicine from a recognized institution
Attainment of relevant Certificate of Competence (COC)
Prior experience in dermatology and aesthetics is advantageous but not mandatory.
Strong interpersonal skills, including effective communication and a positive outlook.
Proficient in English communication and writing.
Ability to read, write, and converse in Chinese will be an added advantage as liaising with our counterparts in China and Chinese customers.
Qualified candidates are offered an attractive remuneration and benefits package aligned with their experience and qualifications.
Application process:
Should you wish to be considered for shortlisting, please complete the attached Google Form at the link below prior to submitting your application on MyCareersFuture:
https://forms.gle/ZdnDCJYqZ916n8iQ7
Please be advised that only candidates who have completed the form and are subsequently shortlisted will be notified.
ClearSK is an equal opportunity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply.

Job Description:
Job Description
The Assistant Nurse Manager will also be responsible for providing assistance and support to the Nurse Manager in the day-to-day operations, improvements and enhancements of clinical nursing services within the nursing home so as to ensure safe, high quality, efficient and cost-effective care is delivered to residents and their families.

Job Responsibilities
 Organise and provide on-the-job training to all staff to ensure there is continual development in the clinical aspects
 Manage and facilitate project teams to keep up-to-date on current trends
 Facilitate and guide staff in establishment and management of relationships with residents and their families and coordinate the administration of care plan between the parties involved
 Guide and teach the nurses on the process and steps to manage incident reporting activities including investigation, report writing and communicating response to the family members involved
 Provide advice and guidance to nurses on the management of complaints and enquiries lodged by residents and their families

Clinical Standards
 Responsible for the compliance of all nursing standards as stipulated by Ministry of Health and Singapore Nursing Board
 Leads quality assurance activities to monitor and evaluate the quality and appropriateness of nursing care
 Ensure quality audits are planned and conducted periodically. Follow up with areas for corrective improvements
 Promotes evidence-based practices or nursing care delivery
 Ensure written policies and procedures and work process are available and up to date to guide the nursing care delivery
 Ensure competency evaluation and conducting in-house training to impart clinical knowledge to less experienced nursing staff

Others
 Organise and facilitate projects and/or research on current issues and trends in the healthcare sector (e.g. infection control)
 Support the Nurse Manager in nursing home management and deputizes in his/her absence

Job Requirements
 Degree or Advance Diploma or Diploma in Nursing
 State Registered Nurse and valid practicing licensed issued by the Singapore Nursing Board
 Valid certification in Basic Cardiac Life Support (BCLS)
 5-6 years of clinical experience out of which 2-3 years must be in the management of chronic patients or 2-3 years as a Senior Staff Nurse
 Possess initiative, drive and self-motivation to persevere and make things happen
 Able to work effectively with diverse teams and all levels of employees to achieve positive outcomes
 High tolerance of stress and ambiguity
 People & Customer Centered

Other info
 Location: Toa Payoh
 Salary: $4000 to $5500
 Nursing home
 5-day work, rotating morning/noon shift

Job Description:
What Youll Do:
Lead and oversee nursing operations within the Geriatric Care department.
Ensure high standards of patient care and safety for elderly patients.
Manage, train, and support a team of skilled nurses specializing in elder care.
Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to achieve optimal health outcomes for older adults.
Drive improvements in clinical practices and operational efficiency tailored to the needs of elderly patients.
What Were Looking For:
Registered Nurse with experience in Geriatric nursing.
Proven leadership and team management skills in a geriatric setting.

Job Description:
Our Veterinarian will deliver the highest quality veterinary care and an exceptional client experience. S/he advocates for pets and their quality of life; builds a long term bonding relationship with clients; contributes to the development and maintenance of the human-pet bond; educates clients and clinic associates on all aspects of pet health; mentors and develops an efficient, collaborative and productive veterinary medical team; and improves both the medical quality and business performance of the clinic.
Deliver the highest level of veterinary care to every pet in a professional and ethical manner while ensuring the client and their pet have an exceptional experience.
Establish trust and gain the confidence and compliance of clients through effectively delivering appropriate preventive care, performing complete diagnostic workups, developing thorough treatment plans, communicating home care instructions, and planning follow-up visits.
Advocate for preventive care and adoption of wellness plans.
Assimilate information gathered through effective history taking, physical examination and diagnostic workup to arrive at an appropriate and effective clinical decision.
Support veterinary team through the daily schedule and caseloads, delegating tasks to paraprofessionals and improving clinic efficiency.
Practice veterinary medicine in a manner compliant with the Animal & Veterinary Service and Mount Pleasant Veterinary Groups Hospital Code of Conduct and Ethics, along with appropriate medical record documentation.
Address and resolve client concerns arising from the medical care of their pet/s.
Collaborate harmoniously with clinic team, peers, leaders and Mars associates, enjoying being a member of the larger veterinary community/profession;
Develop strong lasting relationships with clients.
Partner with field and clinic leadership to design a career development plan which may include medical, surgical, communication and leadership skills.
Strive to achieve performance metrics outlined by medical and field leadership.
Demonstrate integrity and ethics in all actions and behaviors.
Practice evidence-based medicine and preventive care when data or guidelines exist, using sound judgment when they do not.
Perform all basic surgeries with appropriate anesthesia, monitoring and pain management.
Educate clients and clinic associates to improve their level of knowledge about veterinary care and husbandry.
Charge for services rendered and products/prescriptions dispensed.
Mentor veterinary student externs and students in summer jobs programs.
Other assigned duties.
Write to us at MVHAsiaTalent@effem.com if you meet the following criterias:
Doctor of Veterinary Medicine (DVM/VMD) or equivalent degree required.
Veterinary license in good standing or eligibility for licensure with the applicable veterinary board.
Minimum of three years relevant professional veterinarian experience in a pet clinic or hospital environment.
Independent, self-motivated, capable to meet tight timeline.
Attention to details and accuracy with strong sense of urgency.
Ability to handle multi-tasks and respond effectively to ad-hoc requests.
Good stakeholder management skills and strong interpersonal and communication skills.

Job Description:
Mars Veterinary Health (MVH) is a global leading provider of high-quality, advanced veterinary care for companion animals. Our business offers a wide range of high-quality medical services covering preventive and basic health care as well as advanced diagnostics, internal medicine, intensive care, surgery and orthopaedics. MVH also provides rehabilitation, physiotherapy, dietary advice and offers selected pet food, pharmaceutical and care products.

Working together to improve the lives of veterinary professionals, pets and clients.

Our vacancies are at VES Hospital, Mount Pleasant Veterinary Group (of clinics), Hillside Veterinary Surgery and Gentle Oak Veterinary Cinic.

We invite you to join us as Veterinary Technician if you like to work with a team of passionate individuals seeking to provide exceptional care to pets in a challenging and dynamic environment.

Do you have:
Graduate(d) with Diploma in Veterinary Technology or relevant education.
Minimally 2 years work experience in veterinary clinic or hospital preferred.
Could commit to 44 hours work week based on rotation inclusive of weekends.
Want to grow a career in veterinary industry.

Responsibilities:
Lead communications with veterinarians and veterinary medical team to maintain the flow of pets.
Provide professional, efficient and exceptional service at all times.
Obtain relevant information and history from clients to maintain proper and complete medical charts.
Ensure the safety of pets, clients and associates by utilizing safe restraining techniques, following standard protocols while maintaining clean, sterile and organized treatment areas, exams rooms and labs.
Educate clients about preventive care, pet health needs, any diagnosis or treatment, hospital services and other related matters.
Assist with surgery as applicable.
Do note that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
